commit_message:
Depend on normalization in list_flavors

We have a logic case in list_flavors that is easier to understand if the
normalization is applied first. So apply it first.

Change-Id: I27580ff202f71c35dd8099902411fabad005a955

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-01 22:04:44.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_normalize.py', 'shade/_normalize.py'], 'message': "Add unit tests for image and flavor normalization

Also, while we're at it - it turns out we were NOT doing normalization
in any meaningful way on nova-based images. This is ok - I am completely

should fix it.

Change-Id: I4a87bb9b83fcf12ad25ec211c5d13fcf34432793
"}]
commit_message:
Add unit tests for image and flavor normalization

Also, while we're at it - it turns out we were NOT doing normalization
in any meaningful way on nova-based images. This is ok - I am completely
unaware of any clouds that do not expose the glance API any more. But we
should fix it.

Change-Id: I4a87bb9b83fcf12ad25ec211c5d13fcf34432793

subject: Add strict mode for trimming out non-API data
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-11-01 22:04:44.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/strict-mode-d493abc0c3e87945.yaml', 'shade/tests/unit/test__utils.py', 'doc/source/model.rst', 'shade/tests/unit/base.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_normalize.py', 'shade/__init__.py', 'shade/_normalize.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Add strict mode for trimming out non-API data

shade defaults to returning everything under the sun in every form
possible in order to ensure maximum backwards compatability - even with
systems that are not shade itself. However, passthrough fields from
somewhere else could change at any time. This patch adds an opt-in flag
that skips returning passthrough fields anywhere other than the
properties dict.

Change-Id: I7071a406965ed373e77f9592eb76975400cb426b
'}]
commit_message:
Add strict mode for trimming out non-API data

shade defaults to returning everything under the sun in every form
possible in order to ensure maximum backwards compatability - even with
systems that are not shade itself. However, passthrough fields from
somewhere else could change at any time. This patch adds an opt-in flag
that skips returning passthrough fields anywhere other than the
properties dict.

Change-Id: I7071a406965ed373e77f9592eb76975400cb426b

subject: Prevent template validate from scanning ports
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 07:57:01.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/urlfetch.py'], 'message': 'Prevent template validate from scanning ports

The template validation method in the heat API allows to specify the
template to validate using a URL with the 'template_url' parameter.

By entering invalid http URLs, like 'http://localhost:22' it is
possible to scan ports by evaluating the error message of the request.

For example, the request

curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: <TOKEN>" \
-X POST -d '{"template_url": "http://localhost:22"}' \
http://127.0.0.1:8004/v1/<TENANT_ID>/validate

causes the following error message to be returned to the user:

"Could not retrieve template: Failed to retrieve template:
('Connection aborted.',
BadStatusLine('SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_7.2p2 Ubuntu-4ubuntu2.1\\r\\n',))"

This could be misused by tenants to gain knowledge about the internal
network the heat API runs in.

To prevent this information leak, this patch alters the error message
to not include such details when the url scheme is not 'file'.

SecurityImpact

Closes-Bug: #1606500

Change-Id: Id1f86f41c1e6c028d889eca7ccbb9cde67631950
(cherry picked from commit eab9a33ce760c55695a5beb2e541487588b08c98)
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent template validate from scanning ports

The template validation method in the heat API allows to specify the
template to validate using a URL with the 'template_url' parameter.

By entering invalid http URLs, like 'http://localhost:22' it is
possible to scan ports by evaluating the error message of the request.

For example, the request

curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: <TOKEN>" \
-X POST -d '{"template_url": "http://localhost:22"}' \
http://127.0.0.1:8004/v1/<TENANT_ID>/validate

causes the following error message to be returned to the user:

"Could not retrieve template: Failed to retrieve template:
('Connection aborted.',
BadStatusLine('SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_7.2p2 Ubuntu-4ubuntu2.1\\r\\n',))"

This could be misused by tenants to gain knowledge about the internal
network the heat API runs in.

To prevent this information leak, this patch alters the error message
to not include such details when the url scheme is not 'file'.

SecurityImpact

Closes-Bug: #1606500

Change-Id: Id1f86f41c1e6c028d889eca7ccbb9cde67631950
(cherry picked from commit eab9a33ce760c55695a5beb2e541487588b08c98)

commit_message:
Rework gnocchi-upgrade to run in a separate upgrade step

gnocchi when configured with swift will require keystone
to be available to authenticate to migrate to v3. At this
step keystone is not available and gnocchi upgrade fails
with auth error. Instead start apache in step 3, start
apache first and then run gnocchi upgrade in a separate
step and let upgrade happen here.

Closes-Bug: #1634897

Change-Id: I22d02528420e4456f84b80905a7b3a80653fa7b0
(cherry picked from commit a8e119094f5477c132220e30e7a2e1a9915581a3)

subject: Workaround upstream issue with apache2_module
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-02 15:44:27.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/horizon_apache.yml'], 'message': 'Workaround upstream issue with apache2_module

The apache2_module module in Ansible 2.2 is much more strict around
configuration syntax checks and contains a bug [0] preventing MPM
modules from being changed.

Move the enabling of apache2 modules ahead of writing configurations and
temporarily use the command module to enable/disable apache2 modules
until this issue is resolved.

[0] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/5328

Change-Id: I65ffc016b594ebe0d61d1355364d222d0082ee63
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround upstream issue with apache2_module

The apache2_module module in Ansible 2.2 is much more strict around
configuration syntax checks and contains a bug [0] preventing MPM
modules from being changed.

Move the enabling of apache2 modules ahead of writing configurations and
temporarily use the command module to enable/disable apache2 modules
until this issue is resolved.

[0] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/5328

Change-Id: I65ffc016b594ebe0d61d1355364d222d0082ee63

subject: Make ECDiskFileReader check fragment metadata
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-03 11:49:21.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_auditor.py', 'test/unit/__init__.py', 'test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py', 'test/unit/obj/common.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_ssync.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': 'Make ECDiskFileReader check fragment metadata

This patch makes the ECDiskFileReader check the validity of EC
fragment metadata as it reads chunks from disk and quarantine a
diskfile with bad metadata. This in turn means that both the object
auditor and a proxy GET request will cause bad EC fragments to be
quarantined.

This change is motivated by bug 1631144 which may result in corrupt EC
fragments being written to disk but appear valid to the object auditor
md5 hash and content-length checks.

NotImplemented:

 * perform metadata check when a read starts on any frag_size
   boundary, not just at zero

Related-Bug: #1631144
Closes-Bug: #1633647

This is a backport of commit 2a75091c58948fb664016c0e91e72acd313e4610

Change-Id: Ifa6a7f8aaca94c7d39f4aeb9d4fa3f59c4f6ee13
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>
'}]
commit_message:
Make ECDiskFileReader check fragment metadata

This patch makes the ECDiskFileReader check the validity of EC
fragment metadata as it reads chunks from disk and quarantine a
diskfile with bad metadata. This in turn means that both the object
auditor and a proxy GET request will cause bad EC fragments to be
quarantined.

This change is motivated by bug 1631144 which may result in corrupt EC
fragments being written to disk but appear valid to the object auditor
md5 hash and content-length checks.

NotImplemented:

 * perform metadata check when a read starts on any frag_size
   boundary, not just at zero

Related-Bug: #1631144
Closes-Bug: #1633647

This is a backport of commit 2a75091c58948fb664016c0e91e72acd313e4610

Change-Id: Ifa6a7f8aaca94c7d39f4aeb9d4fa3f59c4f6ee13
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

commit_message:
Add ansible role for building and uploading images

Add a role we can use for building and uploading base images for infra.
It's useful right now for two purposes - first in helping to more easily
test image builds for the dib-nodepool work - but also to allow us to
define and manage base images for long-lived infra servers, rather than
relying on images provided by our cloud providers.

It currently relys on an unmerged PR upstream, so add an additional prep
job that installs that version of ansible. We obviously should not
start using this in production until such a time as that PR is landed.

Change-Id: I516c966cf8e764e80a6afbd2a43bc23b59af83cc
Depends-On: I22bc72a4683e2a24b4575abcdac35122df8c57e1

Our cloud providers have wildly variable base images, which makes it
extra fun for automation to be able to do things. For instance, ubuntu
images have an ubuntu user, and centos images have a cloud-user. All
of the images include things like cloud-init which we don't really use.

Instead, make a base images that look the same and have our root ssh key
pre-loaded on them so that launch scripts can just work.

Co-Authored-By: Clint Byrum <clint@fewbar.com>
Change-Id: I8d59d77394a94b5ef915ceb88b7d18d1c358960a
Depends-On: I2746ed256b9783eab058b803130d3ccac484eaeb
"}]
commit_message:
Add elements for Infra servers

Our cloud providers have wildly variable base images, which makes it
extra fun for automation to be able to do things. For instance, ubuntu
images have an ubuntu user, and centos images have a cloud-user. All
of the images include things like cloud-init which we don't really use.

Instead, make a base images that look the same and have our root ssh key
pre-loaded on them so that launch scripts can just work.

Co-Authored-By: Clint Byrum <clint@fewbar.com>
Change-Id: I8d59d77394a94b5ef915ceb88b7d18d1c358960a
Depends-On: I2746ed256b9783eab058b803130d3ccac484eaeb

subject: Split puppet installation into its own element
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-01-12 19:05:48.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/puppet/install.d/05-puppet'], 'message': "Split puppet installation into its own element

We need to install puppet on both nodepool nodes and non-nodepool nodes.
The current nodepool code combines installing puppet and running puppet
into an element. Split that and pull out the code from the infra
element that grabs the system-config repo separately from the other repo
caching so that we can do it the same both times.

Since the puppet element will have a /tmp/system-config outside of the
git cache structure during all image builds anyway, use that in the
running of puppet apply as part of image builds, so that we don't need
_three_ clones of system-config.

Change-Id: I64dbd0107cb5707bb24fb0e97a63af966187d0d8
"}]
commit_message:
Split puppet installation into its own element

We need to install puppet on both nodepool nodes and non-nodepool nodes.
The current nodepool code combines installing puppet and running puppet
into an element. Split that and pull out the code from the infra
element that grabs the system-config repo separately from the other repo
caching so that we can do it the same both times.

Since the puppet element will have a /tmp/system-config outside of the
git cache structure during all image builds anyway, use that in the
running of puppet apply as part of image builds, so that we don't need
_three_ clones of system-config.

Change-Id: I64dbd0107cb5707bb24fb0e97a63af966187d0d8

commit_message:
Add supported Operating System check

Regardless of documentation covering the supported Operating
Systems for a given release, there are still issues that arise
which turn out to relate to someone using an unsupported
OS.

This patch adds an early pre-requisite check for both an AIO
and a full deployment to hard stop the deployment if an
unsupported OS is detected on any host.

Backport of: https://review.openstack.org/392477

Related-Bug: 1638113
Change-Id: I72eaed35b979861ac10d73460c0ac36ed9d7288c
(cherry picked from commit 2daad4883d80f3a06212acc9f5f620fef028f6fd)

With the addition of monasca-statsd as part of
I990472fa059afde37f7e4a1284360c17162aab49, it's a required dependency
even if not used.  For upstream packages which do not have the
monasca-statsd available, we need to be able to continue to have
designate working without it. This change makes the monasca-statsd
dependency optional at runtime by falling back to a noop client that

Closes-Bug: #1630666

commit_message:
Add noop metrics client

With the addition of monasca-statsd as part of
I990472fa059afde37f7e4a1284360c17162aab49, it's a required dependency
even if not used.  For upstream packages which do not have the
monasca-statsd available, we need to be able to continue to have
designate working without it. This change makes the monasca-statsd
dependency optional at runtime by falling back to a noop client that
mocks out the interface for monasca-statsd but does nothing.

Change-Id: Idf986c514b26f1d2799903b2a4e581a1166343cc
Closes-Bug: #1630666

commit_message:
Merge the separated link lines on compute client

On current docstring of service clients, every link to API
reference is separated to 2 lines. That is unreadable on the
code and the documentation which is created from the docstring
also will be unreadablebecause of the separated link lines.

This patch merges the separated lines into a single line for the
readability.

Change-Id: I14bc0f75bb8f149ddee1d20f6ac7129756244f93

commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

unnecessarily and the additional variables are

commit_message:
Ensure upper constraints are respected

With the current python package installation, packages
are installed with no regard to upper constraints. This
can result in an inconsistent set of packages being
installed when re-executing the role.

This patch ensures that if upper constraints are defined
then they are respected.

Change-Id: Id1e7e8f74f513c022e7f06942c65da94ad7df9d8
(cherry picked from commit 25f472cec3ab3c8df1f733e11ad81ead55b4ae8a)

commit_message:
Remove dynamic includes from package installations

For some reason the dynamic includes are working inconsistently,
resulting in failed builds. While it is less desirable to remove
them as this will extend execution time, it is far better to have
reliable build results.

Change-Id: I20cd04b569a067cc78aae369e4480e78bfbd5e5b
(cherry picked from commit c5ec404b88d6b927487a39ef69a99e50724d1586)

subject: Fix KeyError when auditor finds an expired object
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 15:27:25.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_auditor.py', 'swift/obj/auditor.py'], 'message': 'Fix KeyError when auditor finds an expired object

Since the related change [1] the auditor checks deleted objects in
case their tombstone is ready to be reclaimed. However, the auditor
mistakes an expired object for a deleted object because
DiskFileExpired is a subclass of DiskFileDeleted. This causes a
KeyError to be raised and logged because the expired object has no
tombstone info in the ondisk_info data structure.

This patch makes the auditor catch and ignore DiskFileExpired
exceptions before handling DiskFileDeleted exceptions.

[1] Related-Change: I3e99dc702d55a7424c6482969e03cb4afac854a4

Change-Id: I9872b6997d09dcfd8a868c4b91b9379407283b8e
Closes-Bug: #1638016
'}]
commit_message:
Fix KeyError when auditor finds an expired object

Since the related change [1] the auditor checks deleted objects in
case their tombstone is ready to be reclaimed. However, the auditor
mistakes an expired object for a deleted object because
DiskFileExpired is a subclass of DiskFileDeleted. This causes a
KeyError to be raised and logged because the expired object has no
tombstone info in the ondisk_info data structure.

This patch makes the auditor catch and ignore DiskFileExpired
exceptions before handling DiskFileDeleted exceptions.

[1] Related-Change: I3e99dc702d55a7424c6482969e03cb4afac854a4

Change-Id: I9872b6997d09dcfd8a868c4b91b9379407283b8e
Closes-Bug: #1638016

commit_message:
Add option to enable Neutron's SSL middleware

Neutron is now using the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware from
oslo.middlware in its default api-paste configuration [1]. This commit
gives us the ability to enable/disable that middlware.

[1] Ice9ee8f4e04050271d59858f92034c230325718b

Change-Id: I99bc9486fdd85857ce73c413e17400320bd6ec5b
(cherry picked from commit d3630bda9722a83107a3bb77973ba101a77f1287)

commit_message:
Make service profiles default to rabbitmq_node_ips

Instead of hard-coded yaml aliases in t-h-t, make each service
profile that requires rabbit default to the list of rabbit ips.

Note this could still be extended in future to e.g enable per
service rabbit clusters, but the default is to lookup the
hiera which should be logically equivalent to current t-h-t.

Change-Id: Ie53c93456529420588eb1927703ea91b54095d87
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles
(cherry picked from commit e5f0042e47eb4c2b77348dcec0d3d2730e5d9841)

commit_message:
Dell SC: Error creating snapshots with live volume

The create_snapshot function was using an empty provider_id
to attempt to find the live volume associated with a snapshot.
Changed to use the provider_id in the snapshot.volume object.

Change-Id: I5999d698eb82790bc7d8ea8ad45cd7c7d11b6967
Closes-Bug: #1638318

subject: Replace retrying with tenacity
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-11-03 12:37:10.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/zmq_driver/client/zmq_publisher_manager.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_pika.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/pika/test_message.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/zmq_driver/matchmaker/zmq_matchmaker_redis.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/pika_driver/pika_message.py'], 'message': 'Replace retrying with tenacity

This patch replaces the legacy retrying library with the newer
and more convenient tenacity one, taking into account that:
1) retrying uses milliseconds for wait times, but tenacity uses seconds;
2) retrying has a lot of numeric arguments for specifying behaviour
of decorated functions, while tenacity has a few of them, which are
specialized objects, thus making the retry-decorator more flexible.

Change-Id: Ib6ecffe5d1cf292badbb9eb6db6260f17460f343
Closes-Bug: #1635399
'}]
commit_message:
Replace retrying with tenacity

This patch replaces the legacy retrying library with the newer
and more convenient tenacity one, taking into account that:
1) retrying uses milliseconds for wait times, but tenacity uses seconds;
2) retrying has a lot of numeric arguments for specifying behaviour
of decorated functions, while tenacity has a few of them, which are
specialized objects, thus making the retry-decorator more flexible.

Change-Id: Ib6ecffe5d1cf292badbb9eb6db6260f17460f343
Closes-Bug: #1635399

When resizing a in-use volume, if multipath is enabled, function
extend_volume only rescans ONE SCSI device and then run the command:
"multipathd reconfigure"

commit_message:
Multipath device keeps old size when extending volume

When resizing a in-use volume, if multipath is enabled, function
extend_volume only rescans ONE SCSI device and then run the command:
"multipathd reconfigure"
"multipathd resize map mpath_id"
The SCSI device resizes successfully, but the multipath device is
still the old size. This patch fixes it by rescanning all SCSI devices
of the multipath device.

Change-Id: I3a7c7d5e86defedfacd71067f2e5a89bca6aa35b
Closes-Bug: #1611659

commit_message:
Don't assume FQDD naming

Splitting on fixed number of colons breaks in this case :

Disk.Bay.0:Enclosure.Internal.0-1:RAID.Integrated.1-1
Disk.Bay.1:Enclosure.Internal.0-1:RAID.Integrated.1-1
Disk.Bay.2:Enclosure.Internal.0-1:RAID.Integrated.1-1
Disk.Bay.3:Enclosure.Internal.0-1:RAID.Integrated.1-1
Disk.Direct.4:RAID.Integrated.1-1
Disk.Direct.5:RAID.Integrated.1-1

Split from right instead, doesn't fail

Partial-Bug: #1586545

Change-Id: Ib4ca517388c48ade321451cb8af07abb731e5940

commit_message:
Convert to keystoneauth

A direct conversion of keystoneclient usage to the newer supported
keystoneauth library. The libraries are largely compatible and there
should be no issues swapping between them.

This doesn't fix any problems of the way auth is used, it just changes
out the library.

Change-Id: Ibe212e17150a3c750e9c2536a4c869d87e9d4e13

subject: [coreos] Fix: k8s cluster creation with loadbalancer enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-03 13:39:17.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/kubemaster.yaml'], 'message': '[coreos] Fix: k8s cluster creation with loadbalancer enabled

Minions do not register when coreos k8s cluster gets created
with loadbalancer enabled because loadbalancer vip and
pool floating ip are not associated with certificates created
for master.
With this patch minions successfully registers with masters.

Change-Id: Ifc8b6bde5a9bc3dd8c7e965e0450e2aa0d243263
Closes-Bug: #1630189
'}]
commit_message:
[coreos] Fix: k8s cluster creation with loadbalancer enabled

Minions do not register when coreos k8s cluster gets created
with loadbalancer enabled because loadbalancer vip and
pool floating ip are not associated with certificates created
for master.
With this patch minions successfully registers with masters.

Change-Id: Ifc8b6bde5a9bc3dd8c7e965e0450e2aa0d243263
Closes-Bug: #1630189

subject: Make ECDiskFileReader check fragment metadata
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 12:05:25.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_auditor.py', 'test/unit/__init__.py', 'test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py', 'test/unit/obj/common.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_ssync.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': 'Make ECDiskFileReader check fragment metadata

This patch makes the ECDiskFileReader check the validity of EC
fragment metadata as it reads chunks from disk and quarantine a
diskfile with bad metadata. This in turn means that both the object
auditor and a proxy GET request will cause bad EC fragments to be
quarantined.

This change is motivated by bug 1631144 which may result in corrupt EC
fragments being written to disk but appear valid to the object auditor
md5 hash and content-length checks.

NotImplemented:

 * perform metadata check when a read starts on any frag_size
   boundary, not just at zero

Related-Bug: #1631144
Closes-Bug: #1633647

This is a backport of commit 2a75091c58948fb664016c0e91e72acd313e4610

Change-Id: Ifa6a7f8aaca94c7d39f4aeb9d4fa3f59c4f6ee13
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>
'}]
commit_message:
Make ECDiskFileReader check fragment metadata

This patch makes the ECDiskFileReader check the validity of EC
fragment metadata as it reads chunks from disk and quarantine a
diskfile with bad metadata. This in turn means that both the object
auditor and a proxy GET request will cause bad EC fragments to be
quarantined.

This change is motivated by bug 1631144 which may result in corrupt EC
fragments being written to disk but appear valid to the object auditor
md5 hash and content-length checks.

NotImplemented:

 * perform metadata check when a read starts on any frag_size
   boundary, not just at zero

Related-Bug: #1631144
Closes-Bug: #1633647

This is a backport of commit 2a75091c58948fb664016c0e91e72acd313e4610

Change-Id: Ifa6a7f8aaca94c7d39f4aeb9d4fa3f59c4f6ee13
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Adds a check to the probe test introduced in [1].

When the only set of fragments available include a duplicated fragment
index, assert that a GET receives a 404 or 503 response indicating
that the proxy has handled the scenario gracefully. Prior to the
related change [2] the proxy would have returned a 500 due to a
pyeclib exception when duplicate fragments were passed to the decode
function.

1. Related-Change: I06fc381a25613585dd18916d50e7ca2c68d406b6
2. Related-Change: I2310981fd1c4622ff5d1a739cbcc59637ffe3fc3

Change-Id: I16067fa66aed76e6620f4aae83c4fb3bc1a9ed8f
'}]
commit_message:
Check duplicate fragments do not cause 500 status

Adds a check to the probe test introduced in [1].

When the only set of fragments available include a duplicated fragment
index, assert that a GET receives a 404 or 503 response indicating
that the proxy has handled the scenario gracefully. Prior to the
related change [2] the proxy would have returned a 500 due to a
pyeclib exception when duplicate fragments were passed to the decode
function.

1. Related-Change: I06fc381a25613585dd18916d50e7ca2c68d406b6
2. Related-Change: I2310981fd1c4622ff5d1a739cbcc59637ffe3fc3

Change-Id: I16067fa66aed76e6620f4aae83c4fb3bc1a9ed8f

commit_message:
Rework gnocchi-upgrade to run in a separate upgrade step

gnocchi when configured with swift will require keystone
to be available to authenticate to migrate to v3. At this
step keystone is not available and gnocchi upgrade fails
with auth error. Instead start apache in step 3, start
apache first and then run gnocchi upgrade in a separate
step and let upgrade happen here.

Closes-Bug: #1634897

Change-Id: I22d02528420e4456f84b80905a7b3a80653fa7b0

subject: Declare a setup_requires on cython
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-04 17:36:48.000000000', 'files': ['setup.py'], 'message': "Declare a setup_requires on cython

We have a runtime requirement on pandas, which in turn has an
implicit (undeclared) installtime requirement on cython. Add cython
as a setup_requires so that it will be installed in the env prior to
when the pip install of pandas needs it, even though it's
technically only a transitive (installtime) dependency of ours.

If pandas properly adds a setup_requires on cython in the future,
this workaround can be removed.

Change-Id: I507e79f8d3a660340e975a2396440e3eece705c4
"}]
commit_message:
Declare a setup_requires on cython

We have a runtime requirement on pandas, which in turn has an
implicit (undeclared) installtime requirement on cython. Add cython
as a setup_requires so that it will be installed in the env prior to
when the pip install of pandas needs it, even though it's
technically only a transitive (installtime) dependency of ours.

If pandas properly adds a setup_requires on cython in the future,
this workaround can be removed.

Change-Id: I507e79f8d3a660340e975a2396440e3eece705c4

commit_message:
Add default_ntp_server configuration  option

Sahara supports being able to configure the default ntp server for the
cluster instances. This change adds in the configuration value so that a
user can specify the default_ntp_server configuration.

Change-Id: I13aafbf87a0ed4b14797ab2a280318f007481d75
Closes-Bug: #1638676

subject: Fix exc_filters for mysql-python
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 13:37:35.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/sqlalchemy/exc_filters.py', 'oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_exc_filters.py'], 'message': "Fix exc_filters for mysql-python

Something changed in mysql-python / libmysqlclient or mysql and now
exceptions that used to be InternalError's have become OperationalError's.
Update filters accordingly to wrap those into oslo.db exceptions
properly.

OperationalError's are kind of special, as we re-raise them as is due
to historical reasons: we need to make sure that at least SAVEPOINT
errors are wrapped, as that's what oslo.db and neutron unit tests
expect.

Closes-Bug: #1630899

Change-Id: I39ea8c4a0dc9d43992f00da7b1ff502595b4dc13
"}]
commit_message:
Fix exc_filters for mysql-python

Something changed in mysql-python / libmysqlclient or mysql and now
exceptions that used to be InternalError's have become OperationalError's.
Update filters accordingly to wrap those into oslo.db exceptions
properly.

OperationalError's are kind of special, as we re-raise them as is due
to historical reasons: we need to make sure that at least SAVEPOINT
errors are wrapped, as that's what oslo.db and neutron unit tests
expect.

Closes-Bug: #1630899

Change-Id: I39ea8c4a0dc9d43992f00da7b1ff502595b4dc13

commit_message:
Make build_requests.instance MediumText

The build_requests.instance column is a serialized
instance object, and the instances.user_data column
is MediumText, so the build_requests.instance column
itself needs to be at least MediumText in size for MySQL.

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/functional/db/api/test_migrations.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having the 026
API DB migration test in newton.

Change-Id: I7d65df37c02750593037744543ad15e5bc64e913
Closes-Bug: #1635446
(cherry picked from commit fd7b3d64c70eeae34dcf38a847180c60fddfed5c)

commit_message:
conf: Remove invalid floating_ips TODO

The default for StrOpt (and all Opt-subclasses) is None. As such, an
empty string is a valid and useful default.

Change-Id: I4ad301fbb9c6002a232df11b1ea228e8e1838fb8
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-ocata

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-02 19:56:17.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/check-requirements.yml', 'playbooks/openstack-hosts-setup.yml'], 'message': 'Add supported Operating System check

Regardless of documentation covering the supported Operating
Systems for a given release, there are still issues that arise
which turn out to relate to someone using an unsupported
OS.

This patch adds an early pre-requisite check for both an AIO
and a full deployment to hard stop the deployment if an
unsupported OS is detected on any host.

Backport of: https://review.openstack.org/392477

Related-Bug: 1638113
Change-Id: I72eaed35b979861ac10d73460c0ac36ed9d7288c
'}]
commit_message:
Add supported Operating System check

Regardless of documentation covering the supported Operating
Systems for a given release, there are still issues that arise
which turn out to relate to someone using an unsupported
OS.

This patch adds an early pre-requisite check for both an AIO
and a full deployment to hard stop the deployment if an
unsupported OS is detected on any host.

Backport of: https://review.openstack.org/392477

Related-Bug: 1638113
Change-Id: I72eaed35b979861ac10d73460c0ac36ed9d7288c

subject: [simulator] Fix transport_url usage
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 11:17:46.000000000', 'files': ['tools/simulator.py'], 'message': "[simulator] Fix transport_url usage

1) Remove hardcoding 'redis' matchmaker from any zmq:// transport because it's
   fails in cases zmq+etcd:// or zmq+sentinel:// urls.
2) Allow to use transport_url from config file by removing default value for
   args.url option. In this case by default args.url is None and
   transport_url will be used from config file.

Change-Id: I1edcabe46b1e92dd4e6eccc9151b50d03f394186
"}]
commit_message:
[simulator] Fix transport_url usage

1) Remove hardcoding 'redis' matchmaker from any zmq:// transport because it's
   fails in cases zmq+etcd:// or zmq+sentinel:// urls.
2) Allow to use transport_url from config file by removing default value for
   args.url option. In this case by default args.url is None and
   transport_url will be used from config file.

Change-Id: I1edcabe46b1e92dd4e6eccc9151b50d03f394186

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-10-18 18:12:26.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': "Setup ssh-key on subnodes for Ironic

Ironic conductor manages VMs via ssh. When conductor is located on
primary node and VMs are located on subnodes we need to have ssh
connection between nodes. Copy the master SSH key and place it in the
Ironic's default key directory so all conductors (primary and
subnodes) share the same SSH keys.

Update the setup_ssh function to allow specifying the destination file
name of the copies SSH key.  It will now create the id_rsa.pub file
too.

Co-Authored-By: John L. Villalovos <john.l.villalovos@intel.com>
Change-Id: I80a01ac8714dbf569692935cea7319c50f3af3dd
"}]
commit_message:
Setup ssh-key on subnodes for Ironic

Ironic conductor manages VMs via ssh. When conductor is located on
primary node and VMs are located on subnodes we need to have ssh
connection between nodes. Copy the master SSH key and place it in the
Ironic's default key directory so all conductors (primary and
subnodes) share the same SSH keys.

Update the setup_ssh function to allow specifying the destination file
name of the copies SSH key.  It will now create the id_rsa.pub file
too.

Co-Authored-By: John L. Villalovos <john.l.villalovos@intel.com>
Change-Id: I80a01ac8714dbf569692935cea7319c50f3af3dd

subject: Add neutron variant of dsvm tempest full ceph job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 18:34:45.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': 'Add neutron variant of dsvm tempest full ceph job

Since nova-network is deprecated we need to stop using jobs
that use it starting in Ocata.

This change adds a variant of the ceph job which is exactly
the same as the existing job except it uses neutron.

Cinder/Glance/Nova/Tempest are updated to use the new job
on master branch changes only.

The gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-xenial
job is restricted to running on stable/newton changes only.

The gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-trusty
job is restricted to liberty/mitaka changes only by design
because it uses trusty nodes.

The new job configuration is tested here:

Id79cba3d82b0a23b4e57ad95f6b8d3570dca20c6

Change-Id: Id915c6c3fe93ac8a5396acd58aeda03bcc1c3499
'}]
commit_message:
Add neutron variant of dsvm tempest full ceph job

Since nova-network is deprecated we need to stop using jobs
that use it starting in Ocata.

This change adds a variant of the ceph job which is exactly
the same as the existing job except it uses neutron.

Cinder/Glance/Nova/Tempest are updated to use the new job
on master branch changes only.

The gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-xenial
job is restricted to running on stable/newton changes only.

The gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-trusty
job is restricted to liberty/mitaka changes only by design
because it uses trusty nodes.

The new job configuration is tested here:

Id79cba3d82b0a23b4e57ad95f6b8d3570dca20c6

Change-Id: Id915c6c3fe93ac8a5396acd58aeda03bcc1c3499

commit_message:
Add signed image Tempest scenario

This change adds a Tempest test which will
upload a signed image to Glance and Nova in
order to test Glance and Nova's image signature
verification functionality.

Blueprint: image-signing-experimental-gate

Depends-On: Id2d9fb33f7ea667f606a52e789a55a56fc8c8c27

commit_message:
Change Default Image Driver to DockerDriver

Currently 'zun create' command fails if image driver
is GlanceDriver due to bug 'bug/1638494'. This patch
changes default Image Driver to DockerDriver as workaround
until the issue is fixed.

Change-Id: I86ea830016057b0ab84546eb40ded277fba926a2

subject: Statically define the repo build concurrency
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-03 14:53:33.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Statically define the repo build concurrency

The repo build concurrency was pulling the processor core count and using
that int as the value for determining concurrent builds. Sadly,
this value can be high, low, or simply undefined and is entirely dependent
on the Ansible fact gathering system which has additional complexities and
dependencies based on how the hardware has represented the information.

Examples:
  * Should the value be low, 3 or less than, the build process would run
    serially making things painfully slow.
  * Should the value be high the build process may run too many tasks at
    one time causing general system instability.

This commit statically defines the concurrency level as "4" which is small
enough to support vagant, and minimal resource machines, while also being
performant enough to support large scale production clouds.

Change-Id: If2ad496c31c4d0092e7856c3deb07035ebc6c8b9
'}]
commit_message:
Statically define the repo build concurrency

The repo build concurrency was pulling the processor core count and using
that int as the value for determining concurrent builds. Sadly,
this value can be high, low, or simply undefined and is entirely dependent
on the Ansible fact gathering system which has additional complexities and
dependencies based on how the hardware has represented the information.

Examples:
  * Should the value be low, 3 or less than, the build process would run
    serially making things painfully slow.
  * Should the value be high the build process may run too many tasks at
    one time causing general system instability.

This commit statically defines the concurrency level as "4" which is small
enough to support vagant, and minimal resource machines, while also being
performant enough to support large scale production clouds.

Change-Id: If2ad496c31c4d0092e7856c3deb07035ebc6c8b9

subject: Prevent template validate from scanning ports
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 6577, 'name': 'Sergey Kraynev', 'email': 'sergejyit@gmail.com', 'username': 'skraynev'}, {'_account_id': 7253, 'name': 'Jason Dunsmore', 'email': 'jasondunsmore@gmail.com', 'username': 'jbd'}, {'_account_id': 7256, 'name': 'Randall Burt', 'email': 'randall.burt@rackspace.com', 'username': 'randall-burt'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 15371, 'name': 'Tom Patzig', 'email': 'tom.patzig@sap.com', 'username': 'tpatzig'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 07:55:41.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/urlfetch.py'], 'message': 'Prevent template validate from scanning ports

The template validation method in the heat API allows to specify the
template to validate using a URL with the 'template_url' parameter.

By entering invalid http URLs, like 'http://localhost:22' it is
possible to scan ports by evaluating the error message of the request.

For example, the request

curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: <TOKEN>" \
-X POST -d '{"template_url": "http://localhost:22"}' \
http://127.0.0.1:8004/v1/<TENANT_ID>/validate

causes the following error message to be returned to the user:

"Could not retrieve template: Failed to retrieve template:
('Connection aborted.',
BadStatusLine('SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_7.2p2 Ubuntu-4ubuntu2.1\\r\\n',))"

This could be misused by tenants to gain knowledge about the internal
network the heat API runs in.

To prevent this information leak, this patch alters the error message
to not include such details when the url scheme is not 'file'.

SecurityImpact

Closes-Bug: #1606500

Change-Id: Id1f86f41c1e6c028d889eca7ccbb9cde67631950
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent template validate from scanning ports

The template validation method in the heat API allows to specify the
template to validate using a URL with the 'template_url' parameter.

By entering invalid http URLs, like 'http://localhost:22' it is
possible to scan ports by evaluating the error message of the request.

For example, the request

curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: <TOKEN>" \
-X POST -d '{"template_url": "http://localhost:22"}' \
http://127.0.0.1:8004/v1/<TENANT_ID>/validate

causes the following error message to be returned to the user:

"Could not retrieve template: Failed to retrieve template:
('Connection aborted.',
BadStatusLine('SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_7.2p2 Ubuntu-4ubuntu2.1\\r\\n',))"

This could be misused by tenants to gain knowledge about the internal
network the heat API runs in.

To prevent this information leak, this patch alters the error message
to not include such details when the url scheme is not 'file'.

SecurityImpact

Closes-Bug: #1606500

Change-Id: Id1f86f41c1e6c028d889eca7ccbb9cde67631950

commit_message:
Remove unreachable code

If the host list from database is empty compute_node_get_all_by_host()
db api itself raises ComputeHostNotFound exception. There is no need to
check for empty list and raise ComputeHostNotFound exception explicitly.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ia466f15ff8c291f7772fcde2304888f9487fa2a8

subject: Change ostf process's control system
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-28 02:10:03.000000000', 'files': ['devdocs/develop/ostf_contributors_guide.rst'], 'message': "Change ostf process's control system

ubuntu and centos 7 both do not use supervisor as default
process control system. centos 7 use systemd which is compatible
with ubuntu's service script. Use service script to restart ostf
service is more appropriate.

Change-Id: Ibc7791e46aa7fc62e7b1131a31c929f3bfd75f3a
"}]
commit_message:
Change ostf process's control system

ubuntu and centos 7 both do not use supervisor as default
process control system. centos 7 use systemd which is compatible
with ubuntu's service script. Use service script to restart ostf
service is more appropriate.

Change-Id: Ibc7791e46aa7fc62e7b1131a31c929f3bfd75f3a

revisions:

The current constraints generation for the

variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are

Change-Id: Ie860ef9bc223621140205d465298c4009b86118a

commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Change-Id: Ie860ef9bc223621140205d465298c4009b86118a

Implements: blueprint add-support-different-strategy-in-swarmbay

commit_message:
Support scheduler strategy for swarm cluster

Swarm cluster can be created by specifying any of the scheduler
strategy supported by swarm. The strategy can be specified
while creating cluster template using labels parameter, Ex:-
--labels swarm_strategy=spread
Supported values for swarm_strategy=spread, binpack, random

Change-Id: If471f10a3b1f955638a77d5afe462aebdeb4277c
Implements: blueprint add-support-different-strategy-in-swarmbay

commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

manila-specs already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
    setup_requires=['pbr'],

commit_message:
Make sure keepalived is restarted before haproxy.

When using SSL setup for undercloud, the admin and public vip required
for ssl binding by haproxy are created by keepalived.

This makes sure that keepalived is started before haproxy and thus that
the interfaces are indeed present.

This patch also ensures this is happening for overcloud ssl
configuration. The case where another load-balancing technology other
than haproxy is used is not covered.

Closes-Bug: #1638029

Change-Id: I98cb0dcd7f389a1dd38ec8324429bfef4979aa66

commit_message:
Usage of new enginefacade for flavor db

Usage reader and writer for db operations with flavor.

The main problem is that we need to reload relationships(_make_dict
functions) after object is detached from current session, so
_make_dict* were moved under transaction to avoid using the DB
object outside of the transaction.

Partially-Implements blueprint: enginefacade-switch

Change-Id: I583aef9735cfa5984312507f66198d009eef9ce2

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10250, 'name': 'Christopher Dearborn', 'email': 'Christopher.Dearborn@dell.com', 'username': 'cdearbor'}, {'_account_id': 10379, 'name': 'Rajini Karthik', 'email': 'rrajini@gmail.com', 'username': 'rajinir'}, {'_account_id': 13295, 'name': 'Mario Villaplana', 'email': 'mario.villaplana@gmail.com', 'username': 'mariojv'}, {'_account_id': 14525, 'name': 'Vasyl Saienko', 'email': 'vsaienko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vsaienko'}, {'_account_id': 17998, 'name': 'UFCG OneView CI', 'email': 'ufcg-oneview-ci@lsd.ufcg.edu.br', 'username': 'ufcg-oneview-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 19339, 'name': 'Dell EMC Ironic CI', 'email': 'openstack-ironic-ci@dell.com', 'username': 'openstack-ironic-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-31 19:05:23.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/drac/vendor_passthru.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/drac/test_bios.py', 'releasenotes/notes/drac-fix-get_bios_config-vendor-passthru-causes-exception-1e1dbeeb3e924f29.yaml'], 'message': "DRAC get_bios_config() passthru causes exception

The DRAC driver's (pxe_drac) get_bios_config() vendor passthru method
raises an AttributeError exception. It no longer returns the current
BIOS configuration. This is a regression from stable/mitaka.

Triage found that get_bios_config() mistakenly treats the value returned
by python-dracclient's list_bios_settings() as containing named tuples.
When it calls the namedtuple _asdict() method, an AttributeError
exception is raised.

Revert get_bios_config()'s handling of the return value to use __dict__.
Remove the comment that is not consistent with the implementation.

Also revert the unit test case for a successful call to use mock to
create the return value. Use mock.NonCallableMock with an empty
specification (spec) to catch this type of bug in the future.

Change-Id: I94afaa72a1ef25efc1b622e29e3a92a5d27f1892
Closes-Bug: #1637671
"}]
commit_message:
DRAC get_bios_config() passthru causes exception

The DRAC driver's (pxe_drac) get_bios_config() vendor passthru method
raises an AttributeError exception. It no longer returns the current
BIOS configuration. This is a regression from stable/mitaka.

Triage found that get_bios_config() mistakenly treats the value returned
by python-dracclient's list_bios_settings() as containing named tuples.
When it calls the namedtuple _asdict() method, an AttributeError
exception is raised.

Revert get_bios_config()'s handling of the return value to use __dict__.
Remove the comment that is not consistent with the implementation.

Also revert the unit test case for a successful call to use mock to
create the return value. Use mock.NonCallableMock with an empty
specification (spec) to catch this type of bug in the future.

Change-Id: I94afaa72a1ef25efc1b622e29e3a92a5d27f1892
Closes-Bug: #1637671

commit_message:
Remove snapshot scripts for nodepool

Currently these 9 scripts are no longer used by nodepool. While we
could leave them in tree, I'd like to remove them as not to encourage
users to use / reference them.

They have served us well in the past, but no longer of use today.

Change-Id: Ib954ad59988b81a9b60ab4d2dede7f1008cea21a
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-11-01 11:17:37.000000000', 'files': ['manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/base.py', 'manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_quotas.py', 'manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/admin/test_quotas_negative.py', 'manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_quotas_negative.py'], 'message': '[Tempest] Fix visibility of test_quotas.py module

Commit [1] added wrong decorator to test class located in
"manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_quotas.py" module that
made it invisible for tempest.

It should be "ddt.ddt" instead of "ddt.data" as it is now.

Also, fix negative quota tests that were testing wrong thing.
It should have been testing "quota-sets" and "os-quota-sets", not
"services" and "os-services" as it is now.

[1] I82f00114db985b4b3bf4db0a64191559508ac600

Change-Id: Ie0eb7d32b7b032ffdb7f7dd47f68841211e7d7a6
Closes-Bug: #1635588
'}]
commit_message:
[Tempest] Fix visibility of test_quotas.py module

Commit [1] added wrong decorator to test class located in
"manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_quotas.py" module that
made it invisible for tempest.

It should be "ddt.ddt" instead of "ddt.data" as it is now.

Also, fix negative quota tests that were testing wrong thing.
It should have been testing "quota-sets" and "os-quota-sets", not
"services" and "os-services" as it is now.

[1] I82f00114db985b4b3bf4db0a64191559508ac600

Change-Id: Ie0eb7d32b7b032ffdb7f7dd47f68841211e7d7a6
Closes-Bug: #1635588

subject: ram_allocation_ratio was not being set to 1.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 14:09:57.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/nova-scheduler.yaml'], 'message': "ram_allocation_ratio was not being set to 1.0

puppet-nova moved the parameter to the top level. However THT didn't
catch this change.

Fixes bug 1638927

Change-Id: If4bc2453a05053651acfa4a5fa9f9efa238a8958
"}]
commit_message:
ram_allocation_ratio was not being set to 1.0

puppet-nova moved the parameter to the top level. However THT didn't
catch this change.

Fixes bug 1638927

Change-Id: If4bc2453a05053651acfa4a5fa9f9efa238a8958

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 09:49:59.000000000', 'files': ['doc/quickstart.rst'], 'message': 'Add warning about mixing Kolla and OpenStack releases

Seen several instances of users having trouble attempting to mix and

commit_message:
Add warning about mixing Kolla and OpenStack releases

Seen several instances of users having trouble attempting to mix and
match Kolla and OpenStack releases. Add warning that this is not
supported.

Change-Id: Ibdb9e584646599e49a698cfcfaf5f114b5b8943a

subject: Raise openstacksdk upper-constraint to 0.9.9
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 04:02:56.000000000', 'files': ['upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Raise openstacksdk upper-constraint to 0.9.9

Some important fixes for Zaqar v2 API and Senlin v1
API were added in this latest release. Without it,
both senlinclient and senlin integration test for
message receiver don't work.

Change-Id: I57691bb37a0d48d00bb9981c900b04d55fbdb458
"}]
commit_message:
Raise openstacksdk upper-constraint to 0.9.9

Some important fixes for Zaqar v2 API and Senlin v1
API were added in this latest release. Without it,
both senlinclient and senlin integration test for
message receiver don't work.

Change-Id: I57691bb37a0d48d00bb9981c900b04d55fbdb458

commit_message:
Change Python classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim
support for Python 3.5 in the classifier.
This patch also adds the convenience py35 venv.

Delete Python 3.3 classifier and venv

Change-Id: Iea831469dabca9a3806768a2a518ae6c4d85489f

subject: Remove kuryr-lib in upper-constraints.txt file when install master kuryr
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-24 08:15:10.000000000', 'files': ['docker/kuryr/kuryr-base/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Remove kuryr-lib in upper-constraints.txt file when install master kuryr

kuryr add itself to upper-constrains.txt file with kuryr-lib===0.1.0 .
then installing master kuryr which is > 0.1.0 with constraints will
raises an error.  There is nothing we can do unless removing the
kuryr-lib line in upper-constrains.txt file.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Iec7d8a3bc9e00b2d08665329e2f3c2c5ccc43818
'}]
commit_message:
Remove kuryr-lib in upper-constraints.txt file when install master kuryr

kuryr add itself to upper-constrains.txt file with kuryr-lib===0.1.0 .
then installing master kuryr which is > 0.1.0 with constraints will
raises an error.  There is nothing we can do unless removing the
kuryr-lib line in upper-constrains.txt file.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Iec7d8a3bc9e00b2d08665329e2f3c2c5ccc43818

commit_message:
Remove discover as requirement for python-freezerclient

discover is a library that is only required in versions of Python
< 2.7, so we don't need it at all.

Change-Id: Ifa0ea305a3761b507ad4425614a687c470e5507e

Cruz', 'email': 'erlon.rodrigues.cruz@canonical.com', 'username': 'sombrafam'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 20403, 'name': 'Cheng Li', 'email': 'shcli@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'Cheng'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-13 16:11:30.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/initiator/linuxrbd.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/test_linuxrbd.py'], 'message': "Close connection to ceph after cinder bakcup

If we don't close connection to ceph cluster,
The connection count increases with cinder bakcup until exceed max open files.
Then rise OSError: [Errno 24] Too many open files

This patch is to close connection to ceph cluster after cinder backup.

Change-Id: I2fb243d2a57771dc3589e96db54e998e2c1c8ef7
Closes-bug: #1628626
(cherry picked from commit 1d51eb64acebf7bafa277f0060bc5d2c7ca73d52)
"}]
commit_message:
Close connection to ceph after cinder bakcup

If we don't close connection to ceph cluster,
The connection count increases with cinder bakcup until exceed max open files.
Then rise OSError: [Errno 24] Too many open files

This patch is to close connection to ceph cluster after cinder backup.

Change-Id: I2fb243d2a57771dc3589e96db54e998e2c1c8ef7
Closes-bug: #1628626
(cherry picked from commit 1d51eb64acebf7bafa277f0060bc5d2c7ca73d52)

commit_message:
Make Murano always use the latest CoreLibrary

When we updating environment Murano doesn't update
CoreLibrary if it's already installed. So we need
to make it always install latest CoreLibrary version.

Change-Id: I702d6e393fd24dc8649f02b72d83c14aeed3bff9
Closes-Bug: #1624723

commit_message:
Remove services/volume/{v1,v2} directories

Since volume clients v1 and v2  have migrated under lib/services libery,
We do not neet these directories anymore.

gnocchi statsd should be able to send data to port 8125

currently udp port 8125 is blocked by default. This can cause issues
when sending statsd data.

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.
Also, imports was regrouped and placed in alphabetical order.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I192b8bf6f50a85e19640975f0902a014c4ba0878
Signed-off-by: Ruslan Aliev <raliev@mirantis.com>

revisions:

Previous implementation of command "fuel2 node create-vms-conf"
didn't allow using list of dicts for --conf parameter. It required
to use multiple arguments like:
    --conf '{"id": 1}' '{"id": 2}'
which is non obvious for user and inconsistent with UI (in UI
user sees list of dicts).
This patch introduces new possibility to pass parameters
as json list:
    --conf '[{"id": 1}, {"id": 2}]'

Change-Id: I50e961c1afce91fd1c43d1fdcf6436a08a20c2be
Related-Bug: #1582136
Closes-Bug: #1582120
(cherry-picked from commit d0f6840a48f6c3aafa6aafae38439ead364ff831)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow passing list of dicts for create-vms-conf command

Previous implementation of command "fuel2 node create-vms-conf"
didn't allow using list of dicts for --conf parameter. It required
to use multiple arguments like:
    --conf '{"id": 1}' '{"id": 2}'
which is non obvious for user and inconsistent with UI (in UI
user sees list of dicts).
This patch introduces new possibility to pass parameters
as json list:
    --conf '[{"id": 1}, {"id": 2}]'

Change-Id: I50e961c1afce91fd1c43d1fdcf6436a08a20c2be
Related-Bug: #1582136
Closes-Bug: #1582120
(cherry-picked from commit d0f6840a48f6c3aafa6aafae38439ead364ff831)

subject: Make nova server user_data format configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-10-03 09:34:16.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py', 'heat/common/config.py'], 'message': "Make nova server user_data format configurable

Nova server property user_data_format default equals to
HEAT_CFNTOOLS since resource creation, so there's time to
move on - this format currently still used, but by no means all.
So add config option to easier changing default user_data_format
for flexible configuration of desired heat behaviour.

Now for specifying user_data_format default value, need just set
config option default_user_data_format equals to
HEAT_CFNTOOLS/RAW/SOFTWARE_CONFIG (underline as necessary) in default
section of heat config file.

Change-Id: Iabfd07a893282245cdd8a4a0afc26e9401f44c96
Closes-bug: #1629336
"}]
commit_message:
Make nova server user_data format configurable

Nova server property user_data_format default equals to
HEAT_CFNTOOLS since resource creation, so there's time to
move on - this format currently still used, but by no means all.
So add config option to easier changing default user_data_format
for flexible configuration of desired heat behaviour.

Now for specifying user_data_format default value, need just set
config option default_user_data_format equals to
HEAT_CFNTOOLS/RAW/SOFTWARE_CONFIG (underline as necessary) in default
section of heat config file.

Change-Id: Iabfd07a893282245cdd8a4a0afc26e9401f44c96
Closes-bug: #1629336

Currently user can only set the multiattach property during
volume creation. There is no way to modify the property later.
Proposed blueprint allow setting the multiattach property of
existing volumes using Volume update() REST API and the cinder
cli command interface.

Change-Id: Ia9bdd6926df5ba83e2af158efa409eb2363cc878
'}]
commit_message:
Allow setting multiattach property

Currently user can only set the multiattach property during
volume creation. There is no way to modify the property later.
Proposed blueprint allow setting the multiattach property of
existing volumes using Volume update() REST API and the cinder
cli command interface.

Change-Id: Ia9bdd6926df5ba83e2af158efa409eb2363cc878

commit_message:
Remove dynamic includes from package installations

For some reason the dynamic includes are working inconsistently,
resulting in failed builds. While it is less desirable to remove
them as this will extend execution time, it is far better to have
reliable build results.

Change-Id: I20cd04b569a067cc78aae369e4480e78bfbd5e5b

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-31 04:10:18.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it

Change-Id: I4caf7f55dbe992863eaea07ddbbfe0070c1f5fd8
"}]
commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator. Removing openstack/commonfrom
all OpenStack code in favor of the Oslo libraries is a project wide goal
for the Ocata release. So don't use this directory any more. We should drop it
for improving searching efficiency.

Change-Id: I4caf7f55dbe992863eaea07ddbbfe0070c1f5fd8

subject: playbooks: Do not serialize ironic deployment
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 12459, 'name': 'Stephanie Miller', 'email': 'stephane@alum.mit.edu', 'username': 'cinerama'}, {'_account_id': 22474, 'name': 'OPNFV CI', 'email': 'opnfvci@gmail.com', 'username': 'opnfvci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23163, 'name': 'Markos Chandras (hwoarang)', 'email': 'markos@chandras.me', 'username': 'mchandras'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-20 12:54:49.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/test-bifrost-dhcp.yaml', 'playbooks/test-bifrost.yaml', 'playbooks/test-bifrost-dynamic.yaml'], 'message': 'playbooks: Do not serialize ironic deployment

This somewhat reverts 87a32c631167ade7a0f620391fbd18378c7e6819
("Serialize localhost actions during final host deployment").
The only point where we want to serialize the steps is when accessing
common files on the host. In the bifrost-deploy-nodes-dynamic role,
all tasks are accessing files based on the 'inventory_hostname'
variable, which means there is no conflict there and tasks on these
role can run in parallel. This allows bifrost to provision machines
in parallel during pxe boot which speeds up the entire operation.

Change-Id: If41ab3aef8758a72d95088509903fef111d5d5bb
'}]
commit_message:
playbooks: Do not serialize ironic deployment

This somewhat reverts 87a32c631167ade7a0f620391fbd18378c7e6819
("Serialize localhost actions during final host deployment").
The only point where we want to serialize the steps is when accessing
common files on the host. In the bifrost-deploy-nodes-dynamic role,
all tasks are accessing files based on the 'inventory_hostname'
variable, which means there is no conflict there and tasks on these
role can run in parallel. This allows bifrost to provision machines
in parallel during pxe boot which speeds up the entire operation.

Change-Id: If41ab3aef8758a72d95088509903fef111d5d5bb

subject: Add supported Operating System check
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-03 09:19:41.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/check-requirements.yml', 'playbooks/openstack-hosts-setup.yml'], 'message': 'Add supported Operating System check

Regardless of documentation covering the supported Operating
Systems for a given release, there are still issues that arise
which turn out to relate to someone using an unsupported
OS.

This patch adds an early pre-requisite check for both an AIO
and a full deployment to hard stop the deployment if an
unsupported OS is detected on any host.

Related-Bug: 1638113
Change-Id: I6bc1a15e1283d496adb82a67989486f814e341c7
(cherry picked from commit c8da904f009dfdc58a119ab98ebe67ca17213b6b)
'}]
commit_message:
Add supported Operating System check

Regardless of documentation covering the supported Operating
Systems for a given release, there are still issues that arise
which turn out to relate to someone using an unsupported
OS.

This patch adds an early pre-requisite check for both an AIO
and a full deployment to hard stop the deployment if an
unsupported OS is detected on any host.

Related-Bug: 1638113
Change-Id: I6bc1a15e1283d496adb82a67989486f814e341c7
(cherry picked from commit c8da904f009dfdc58a119ab98ebe67ca17213b6b)

commit_message:
trove-integration should use zuul user

Now that Jenkins has been retired in favour of pure Zuul, we
should remove references to the jenkins user in the
trove-integration scripts.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-June/097595.html for reference.

Closes-Bug: #1593771

Change-Id: I36f087a076f199c5966bbf550b234a3d7bc9f1ba

commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of magnum. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy.

Closes-Bug: #1590608

commit_message:
Add nonblocking_notify to Swift proxy ceilometer config

This allows to send Ceilometer notifications in a background thread, no
longer blocking Swift proxy if the RabbitMQ is not available.

This patch does not change the default behavior.

Change-Id: Iad1f69f273fe80176c6010f8f3cc24313d7c5ab4
(cherry picked from commit 49a4be72777616f0b721c3779cf29f146311240d)

subject: Do not have heat to connect to external service
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 16:58:07.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/orchestration/stacks/test_templates_negative.py'], 'message': 'Do not have heat to connect to external service

The test_templates_negative haves heat to connect to an external
service. www.example.com is a registered exisitng domain,
and it also has an AAAA record.

This negative tests have heat to download a `template` from the
example.com .

If you have IPv6 local network, but you do not have a real outside
connectiviy over IPv6 this test tooks a lot of time (~2 minute).

Tempest should not have hardcoded urls for anytinhg,
what the services will use.

This change simply removes the host name from the `bad` urls,
to be deterministicly bad.

Alternatively would be adding extra config options.

Change-Id: Ib198164e544a2bf8426778e39bb616aaa468087c
'}]
commit_message:
Do not have heat to connect to external service

The test_templates_negative haves heat to connect to an external
service. www.example.com is a registered exisitng domain,
and it also has an AAAA record.

This negative tests have heat to download a `template` from the
example.com .

If you have IPv6 local network, but you do not have a real outside
connectiviy over IPv6 this test tooks a lot of time (~2 minute).

Tempest should not have hardcoded urls for anytinhg,
what the services will use.

This change simply removes the host name from the `bad` urls,
to be deterministicly bad.

Alternatively would be adding extra config options.

Change-Id: Ib198164e544a2bf8426778e39bb616aaa468087c

commit_message:
DIB element to support cinder local attach/detach functionality

This element adds python-brick-cinderclient-ext to the make customized image
to support cinder local attach/detach functionality. Currently it has the
dependency on known bug<https://launchpad.net/bugs/1623549>, which would be
resolved with next release of python-brick-cinderclient-ext.

commit_message:
Added audit run and outofsync commands

fuel2 audit noop starts the
noop run on the environment

fuel2 audit list outofsync
checks the puppet reports of the deployment task and
extracts all the resources, that would have changed
during the actual puppet run.

Change-Id: Ibf2f5467fd6b05cf437f59fdb462bbde14635632

commit_message:
Moved gitrepo-related commands to a separate file

This commit moves handlers for gitrepo-related commands
from fuelclient.py to fuelclient_gitrepo.py to do 2
things:
- overcome potential shadowing issues (from fuelclient import)
- prepare for introduction of audit-related subcommands, which
  would be placed in a separate file

Change-Id: Ia216205482de210b2a1126b9d62d2359fbf60005

subject: [Container] Fix deletion of veths
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2417, 'name': 'Ben Swartzlander', 'email': 'ben@swartzlander.org', 'username': 'bswartz'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 11865, 'name': 'Clinton Knight', 'email': 'cknight@netapp.com', 'username': 'cknight'}, {'_account_id': 13144, 'name': 'Oracle ZFSSA CI', 'username': 'oracle-zfssa-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14567, 'name': 'Rodrigo Barbieri', 'email': 'rodrigo.barbieri@canonical.com', 'username': 'ganso'}, {'_account_id': 16203, 'name': 'zengyingzhe', 'email': 'zengyingzhe@huawei.com', 'username': 'zengyingzhe'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-10 15:42:59.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/container/test_driver.py', 'manila/share/drivers/container/driver.py'], 'message': '[Container] Fix deletion of veths

In '_teardown_server' method driver was searching for all matches of
'veth' prefix and looping them for deletion. But using Xenial host
it finds each such veth name twice and tries to delete the same veth
twice too getting following error:

ovs-vsctl: no row "veth7ac5738" in table Interface

So, fix it by translating 'list' of veths to 'set' that
will have only unique names.

Change-Id: I819a885547f9fc595b15f98e4c94de21e33914ac
Closes-Bug: #1630512
(cherry picked from commit 8401c150f3488b3445496cd0807207b9171f61cb)
'}]
commit_message:
[Container] Fix deletion of veths

In '_teardown_server' method driver was searching for all matches of
'veth' prefix and looping them for deletion. But using Xenial host
it finds each such veth name twice and tries to delete the same veth
twice too getting following error:

ovs-vsctl: no row "veth7ac5738" in table Interface

So, fix it by translating 'list' of veths to 'set' that
will have only unique names.

Change-Id: I819a885547f9fc595b15f98e4c94de21e33914ac
Closes-Bug: #1630512
(cherry picked from commit 8401c150f3488b3445496cd0807207b9171f61cb)

commit_message:
Rework processorcount limits to os_workers

* reduce workers_max default limits of a 16 to the $::os_workers, which is limited by [2, 8] interval.
* reduce workers/pool size/overflow limited by F($::processorcount) to F($::os_workers)

Closes-bug: 1629238

Change-Id: I5cc4d70b902eeaa1c9cf42911606eba13dd84aa2
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Move all conf option to centralize conf directory

Currently, all config options of Zun were found in
separate package/module. This is somehow hard for new
developer joining Zun team to use/add new config options.
This patch moves all config option to central place.

Change-Id: I2940d295b413b9c802f09be8d418c3721e2f423c

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-02 15:04:10.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/controllers/v1/types.py', 'releasenotes/notes/lookup-ignore-malformed-macs-09e7e909f3a134a3.yaml', 'ironic/tests/unit/api/v1/test_ramdisk.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/ramdisk.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/api/v1/test_types.py'], 'message': "API: lookup() ignore malformed MAC addresses

This patch is adding code to ignore malformed MAC addresses which are
called as part of the lookup() mechanism. Prior to this patch, if a MAC
address wasn't in the expected format (six octets) the deployment of the
node would fail because the ramdisk wouldn't be able to lookup which
node it was in the Ironic database. One way to trigger this problem was
to deploy a node with an Infiniband Card which the MAC address (or GID)
contains 20 octets, that would result in a deployment failure even when
that NIC wasn't used by Ironic at all (not enrolled as a port).

The ListOfMacAdresses type was also deleted as part of this patch
because it wasn't used anywhere else.

Change-Id: I614fe63236985438d2f354d17a15d17649e72912
Closes-Bug: #1633585
"}]
commit_message:
API: lookup() ignore malformed MAC addresses

This patch is adding code to ignore malformed MAC addresses which are
called as part of the lookup() mechanism. Prior to this patch, if a MAC
address wasn't in the expected format (six octets) the deployment of the
node would fail because the ramdisk wouldn't be able to lookup which
node it was in the Ironic database. One way to trigger this problem was
to deploy a node with an Infiniband Card which the MAC address (or GID)
contains 20 octets, that would result in a deployment failure even when
that NIC wasn't used by Ironic at all (not enrolled as a port).

The ListOfMacAdresses type was also deleted as part of this patch
because it wasn't used anywhere else.

Change-Id: I614fe63236985438d2f354d17a15d17649e72912
Closes-Bug: #1633585

commit_message:
Stop using mox in unit/api/v2/ tests

As mox is not compatible with python 3, all test cases
that use mox should be updated to use mock instead.

Replaced stubs.Set() with mock_object() in some classes in
cinder/tests/unit/api/v2/*.py.

Removed some mocks from setUp() so we don't need to call
stubs.UnsetAll().

Change-Id: I28a39d41bc32fd0bb474b9092947b68498af1620

subject: ceph: make computed measures write async
revisions:
[{'number': 30, 'created': '2016-10-04 07:23:47.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install.rst', 'gnocchi/storage/ceph.py', 'gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'ceph: make computed measures write async

Carbonara drivers can implement _wait_async_completion() to wait for async
IO to finish before releasing the metric lock

All write that occurs during process_new_measures are now async in ceph
driver.

This raise the minimum version of cradox and python-rados
we need to get the new aio API.

Change-Id: I40de0d6896d062af79c996787b4387f8b7c3f1d2
'}]
commit_message:
ceph: make computed measures write async

Carbonara drivers can implement _wait_async_completion() to wait for async
IO to finish before releasing the metric lock

All write that occurs during process_new_measures are now async in ceph
driver.

This raise the minimum version of cradox and python-rados
we need to get the new aio API.

Change-Id: I40de0d6896d062af79c996787b4387f8b7c3f1d2

commit_message:
Increase the timeout for the default plan creation

A CI job recently hit this [1] but there were no errors. So it seems
sometimes it might take longer than we previously guessed. This change
doubles the value to be safe.

[1]: http://logs.openstack.org/45/390745/1/gate/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha-multinode/6e84764/console.html#_2016-10-27_17_47_05_955798

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-02 21:51:13.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/admin/test_routers_dvr.py'], 'message': 'Require l3-ha extension for test_centralized_router_update_to_dvr

Since Ib262f32133aae50cdb01d2489830499fb5c30f44, the test explicitly
passes ha=False argument when creating a centralized router. This
attribute belongs to l3-ha API extension, and may be not present for
some neutron setups (f.e. when using networking-odl).

Skip the test if the extension is not enabled.

Change-Id: I71059bb2fd8c13270b7a9c3f0a6a07de310b26fc
'}]
commit_message:
Require l3-ha extension for test_centralized_router_update_to_dvr

Since Ib262f32133aae50cdb01d2489830499fb5c30f44, the test explicitly
passes ha=False argument when creating a centralized router. This
attribute belongs to l3-ha API extension, and may be not present for
some neutron setups (f.e. when using networking-odl).

Skip the test if the extension is not enabled.

Change-Id: I71059bb2fd8c13270b7a9c3f0a6a07de310b26fc

image-create API fails when repo is not passed because we are
trying to split a None string in parse_image_tag method.
This patch fixes the issue by checking the param passed to method

Change-Id: If901403ee4f789f9bf73bb1eccba5a53c8ac0f3e
Closes-bug: #1638475

commit_message:
Fix issue in image-create API

image-create API fails when repo is not passed because we are
trying to split a None string in parse_image_tag method.
This patch fixes the issue by checking the param passed to method
against None and also adds unit test cases to support this patch.

Change-Id: If901403ee4f789f9bf73bb1eccba5a53c8ac0f3e
Closes-bug: #1638475

subject: Fix duplication of FD close in storlet_gateway
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-11-02 04:24:14.000000000', 'files': ['Engine/swift/storlet_gateway/gateways/docker/runtime.py', 'tests/unit/swift/storlet_gateway/gateways/docker/test_runtime.py'], 'message': 'Fix duplication of FD close in storlet_gateway

storlet_gateway duplicates following FD close now.(all remote side FD)

storlets PUT request: self.execution_str_write_fd, self.data_write_fd,
                      self.metadata_write_fd, self._input_data_read_fd
storlets GET request: self.execution_str_write_fd, self.data_write_fd,
                      self.metadata_write_fd

Because "_close_remote_side_descriptors" is called twice.

This patch modifies the called "_close_remote_side_descriptors" to once.

Change-Id: I60c537a6747fdff678bfe998ccb5bebf77ac37a0
Closes-Bug: #1635088
'}]
commit_message:
Fix duplication of FD close in storlet_gateway

storlet_gateway duplicates following FD close now.(all remote side FD)

storlets PUT request: self.execution_str_write_fd, self.data_write_fd,
                      self.metadata_write_fd, self._input_data_read_fd
storlets GET request: self.execution_str_write_fd, self.data_write_fd,
                      self.metadata_write_fd

Because "_close_remote_side_descriptors" is called twice.

This patch modifies the called "_close_remote_side_descriptors" to once.

Change-Id: I60c537a6747fdff678bfe998ccb5bebf77ac37a0
Closes-Bug: #1635088

subject: Use custom CA cert with tripleo-ansible-inventory
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-02 17:22:01.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo-ansible-inventory'], 'message': 'Use custom CA cert with tripleo-ansible-inventory

When using SSL undercloud and internal certificate authority,
tripleo-ansible-inventory cannot retrieve the host list.

Add the --cacert option and default it to the OS_CACERT environment
variabled to make the listing successful.

The variable name is the conventional one used by all the clients, see:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/SecureClientConnections

Change-Id: Id77e410abbf797b39bf6e19ad26e8d0e44f8555c
(cherry picked from commit 622454b86c898318e4def70467006e7159fecfbd)
'}]
commit_message:
Use custom CA cert with tripleo-ansible-inventory

When using SSL undercloud and internal certificate authority,
tripleo-ansible-inventory cannot retrieve the host list.

Add the --cacert option and default it to the OS_CACERT environment
variabled to make the listing successful.

The variable name is the conventional one used by all the clients, see:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/SecureClientConnections

Change-Id: Id77e410abbf797b39bf6e19ad26e8d0e44f8555c
(cherry picked from commit 622454b86c898318e4def70467006e7159fecfbd)

subject: Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-28 14:08:36.000000000', 'files': ['MANIFEST.in'], 'message': "Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

magnum-ui already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
    setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
    pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: I4ed97d00cd5ead11f7b897bf715e14e6d54a6946
"}]
commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

magnum-ui already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
    setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
    pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: I4ed97d00cd5ead11f7b897bf715e14e6d54a6946

commit_message:
Add a validation-specific Ansible output callback

The validations have a few specifics in how they're used and what
information is important. So this formats the validation output in a way
that should highlight the failures themselves and make it more obvious
what went wrong and what to do when a validation fails.

Change-Id: I9730f2dd04868c5de46ae90bd545865d17aec530
Closes-Bug: #1625526
(cherry picked from commit e10338ce4adc99efe9e5764d7a4b85c5a5c6d883)

The releasenotes conf.py files are fine now, we can remove the hack.
