subject: Validate rogue DHCP servers
revisions:

Change-Id: I22d4bf31e8f528e345b1a0a3ec972beea13d4f52

commit_message:
Validate rogue DHCP servers

This adds two validations that check for unexpected DHCP servers in the
networks used for hardware introspection and provisioning.

Both validations depend on a file that sends a DHCP request for each
interface specified in its arguments and fails if there are any
responses.

Closes-Bug: #1620332
Change-Id: I22d4bf31e8f528e345b1a0a3ec972beea13d4f52
(cherry picked from commit 0a608f83bd9cd59b8744fc69807b8f0c7c9fc028)

commit_message:
Add cross-repo job for fuel-ccp* projects

Jobs is expected to run for all fuel-ccp* base and component repos and
run script from fuel-ccp repo that currently is a simple script that
runs validation by cloning all masters, but it is expeted to be extended
with use of zuul-cloner for proper integration with Zuul.

subject: Restrict gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ubuntu-xenial to newton
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-02 20:02:43.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Restrict gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ubuntu-xenial to newton

The gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ubuntu-xenial job uses nova-network
which is deprecated since newton. In Ocata the default network
backend in jobs is going to be neutron and we need to start
removing jobs that use nova-network from Ocata runs. Since
gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ubuntu-xenial is in the integrated gate
it's a global job and this is a global cap so that it only
runs on stable/newton changes. As noted in the change, we'll
still have nova-network coverage in the cells v1 job in Ocata.

Change-Id: I3c13cb525da126e272789d0db6301f5e58c13b51
"}]
commit_message:
Restrict gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ubuntu-xenial to newton

The gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ubuntu-xenial job uses nova-network
which is deprecated since newton. In Ocata the default network
backend in jobs is going to be neutron and we need to start
removing jobs that use nova-network from Ocata runs. Since
gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ubuntu-xenial is in the integrated gate
it's a global job and this is a global cap so that it only
runs on stable/newton changes. As noted in the change, we'll
still have nova-network coverage in the cells v1 job in Ocata.

Change-Id: I3c13cb525da126e272789d0db6301f5e58c13b51

commit_message:
Rename gate-grenade-dsvm-multinode-live-migration-nv

This just adds -neutron- to the name to make it clear
that this job uses neutron as the network backend.

Otherwise it was easy to confuse this with gate-grenade-dsvm-multinode
which doesn't use neutron.

Change-Id: Ib7143bee9e8a159c53a972e83b10721a2142ce8f

subject: Explicitly set DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=0 for nova-net grenade jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 19:32:47.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "Explicitly set DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=0 for nova-net grenade jobs

We're going to have conditional logic in devstack-gate for setting
the default value of DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON. That will only set
the value from a default if not explicitly defined, and it's going
to change the default to enable neutron in Ocata.

This change explicitly sets DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=0 in the
nova-network specific grenade jobs.

Note there are some other grenade jobs defined which don't specify
if neutron or nova-network should be used so they always relied
on the default in devstack-gate. So for grenade going from newton
to ocata those jobs will start using neutron, which is a change
and might work, or might not, but we'll have to explicitly define
the network backend to use, or cap those jobs based on branch, if
they don't work with neutron.

Change-Id: I33e8c81bb5366d2d1feccc144baa54ed3ed51e33
"}]
commit_message:
Explicitly set DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=0 for nova-net grenade jobs

We're going to have conditional logic in devstack-gate for setting
the default value of DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON. That will only set
the value from a default if not explicitly defined, and it's going
to change the default to enable neutron in Ocata.

This change explicitly sets DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=0 in the
nova-network specific grenade jobs.

Note there are some other grenade jobs defined which don't specify
if neutron or nova-network should be used so they always relied
on the default in devstack-gate. So for grenade going from newton
to ocata those jobs will start using neutron, which is a change
and might work, or might not, but we'll have to explicitly define
the network backend to use, or cap those jobs based on branch, if
they don't work with neutron.

Change-Id: I33e8c81bb5366d2d1feccc144baa54ed3ed51e33

subject: Make the cells v1 job run explicitly with nova-network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 19:06:55.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/cells.yaml'], 'message': "Make the cells v1 job run explicitly with nova-network

The cells v1 job won't work with neutron, so it has to run
with nova-network. As we're looking to globally switch
DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON to 1 (the default) in devstack-gate
for the master branch (Ocata) if not specified, we need to
specify this for the cells v1 job.

See I6ece30e823c0cf21fbb2f37568c669dd7d3c6a08

Change-Id: If86b061be095ed5cfc7a5f5594f84abae68baab0
"}]
commit_message:
Make the cells v1 job run explicitly with nova-network

The cells v1 job won't work with neutron, so it has to run
with nova-network. As we're looking to globally switch
DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON to 1 (the default) in devstack-gate
for the master branch (Ocata) if not specified, we need to
specify this for the cells v1 job.

See I6ece30e823c0cf21fbb2f37568c669dd7d3c6a08

Change-Id: If86b061be095ed5cfc7a5f5594f84abae68baab0

commit_message:
update trove ci for python-troveclient project

This change adds a skip on the test gate-trove-legacy-functional-* for
branches other than liberty, mitaka and newton.

It extends the logic that skips this for the trove project. I tried to
have two projects in the same skip-if but that didn't seem to work;
this one does seem to work.

commit_message:
add non-voting multinode job for networking-odl carbon release

Multinode networking-odl setup test is required as part
of Neutron Stadium evolution [1]. Set to non-voting
untill upstream ODL issues are fixed and it's proven stable.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/networking-odl/+spec/
neutron-stadium-evolution

Change-Id: I090937d1eeb8892b95267f8a6ad11b9673f4140b
Closes-bug: #1633242

subject: remove wheel jobs from release queue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 19:49:07.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'remove wheel jobs from release queue

We do not need to run all of the wheel jobs every time we tag a
release, so remove them from that queue. We leave them in the periodic
queue for now, with the idea that we will move them to a higher
frequency in a separate patch, if needed.

Change-Id: I400c5c3df1229a9dd010babad539452e3e1404ab
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
remove wheel jobs from release queue

We do not need to run all of the wheel jobs every time we tag a
release, so remove them from that queue. We leave them in the periodic
queue for now, with the idea that we will move them to a higher
frequency in a separate patch, if needed.

Change-Id: I400c5c3df1229a9dd010babad539452e3e1404ab
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Remove unused trusty jobs from tempest zuul config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 20:09:13.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove unused trusty jobs from tempest zuul config

Tempest is branchless so all changes run against the
master branch which by definition only runs on xenial
nodes. So besides the liberty and mitaka compat jobs that
run on ubuntu trusty, we can remove all of these other
unused trusty jobs from the tempest zuul config.

Change-Id: Ib9a6be562b9c750deac7322c10587bcfce204f73
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unused trusty jobs from tempest zuul config

Tempest is branchless so all changes run against the
master branch which by definition only runs on xenial
nodes. So besides the liberty and mitaka compat jobs that
run on ubuntu trusty, we can remove all of these other
unused trusty jobs from the tempest zuul config.

Change-Id: Ib9a6be562b9c750deac7322c10587bcfce204f73

commit_message:
Enable proxy headers parsing for Neutron

http_proxy_to_wsgi middleware was recently added to Neutron [1] and
in order to take it into use, we need to enable it via hiera.

[1] Ice9ee8f4e04050271d59858f92034c230325718b
Depends-On: I99bc9486fdd85857ce73c413e17400320bd6ec5b
Related-Bug: #1590608

Change-Id: I10c065e726f2708e09acfc04dac3cae34a534d23

commit_message:
Add option to enable Neutron's SSL middleware

Neutron is now using the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware from
oslo.middlware in its default api-paste configuration [1]. This commit
gives us the ability to enable/disable that middlware.

[1] Ice9ee8f4e04050271d59858f92034c230325718b

Change-Id: I99bc9486fdd85857ce73c413e17400320bd6ec5b

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8392, 'name': 'Aleksey Kasatkin', 'email': 'akasatkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aleksey'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10391, 'name': 'Ihor Kalnytskyi', 'email': 'ihor@kalnytskyi.com', 'username': 'ikalnitsky'}, {'_account_id': 18205, 'name': 'Bulat Gaifullin', 'email': 'gaifullinbf@gmail.com', 'username': 'bgaifullin'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-25 19:27:06.000000000', 'files': ['fuelclient/tests/unit/v2/cli/test_deployment_graph.py', 'fuelclient/commands/graph.py'], 'message': "Align parameters of 'fuel2 graph download' command

Now 'fuel2 graph download' command can be executed without
specifying any task level parameters that leads to erroneous
behavior, i.e. plugins task level graph is downloading by default.
This patch fixes such behavior and makes task level parameters
mandatory, e.g.:
       fuel2 graph download [-h] -e ENV (-a | -c | -p | -r)
                            [-t GRAPH_TYPE] [-f FILE]

Change-Id: I5ed561cda9b0d35043822d01b6bb0b37df451fcb
"}]
commit_message:
Align parameters of 'fuel2 graph download' command

Now 'fuel2 graph download' command can be executed without
specifying any task level parameters that leads to erroneous
behavior, i.e. plugins task level graph is downloading by default.
This patch fixes such behavior and makes task level parameters
mandatory, e.g.:
       fuel2 graph download [-h] -e ENV (-a | -c | -p | -r)
                            [-t GRAPH_TYPE] [-f FILE]

Change-Id: I5ed561cda9b0d35043822d01b6bb0b37df451fcb

volume was not able to be initialized.

Added a generic debug log message to find_volume.

commit_message:
Dell SC: Add init_volume check and logging

Added a check to make sure the init_volume function uses
a physical server. Added a check and log message if the
volume was not able to be initialized.

Added a generic debug log message to find_volume.

Added a log message when the provider_id is no longer valid.

Change-Id: I385d3d8518ac5c60944f21d670f35e974eef28a0

subject: Do not try to check for existing snapshots on Windows
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-03 05:40:39.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/lib/osbash/functions-host.sh'], 'message': 'Do not try to check for existing snapshots on Windows

There is no code to check for existing snapshots on Windows. Listing
them for that purpose just produces an error condition if the snapshot
does not exist (the common case) and the build aborts.

This patch removes the snapshot listing call from the Windows batch
files; it fixes a regression introduced with commit
3678ef2fa9893468604411ff697361bbd48d1e73.

Change-Id: I5df74d6e2efcabdf061cabe92d5da92d7a624740
Backports: 905070527fe2a6157672fc1a75977d8d62ac9a87
Closes-Bug: #1606766
Depends-On: I221cabdf5e9948dda81cefdff7c8f3b3ab96817c
(cherry picked from commit 730b7efed3ce542991a34f9cf2f083ae4f888e15)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not try to check for existing snapshots on Windows

There is no code to check for existing snapshots on Windows. Listing
them for that purpose just produces an error condition if the snapshot
does not exist (the common case) and the build aborts.

This patch removes the snapshot listing call from the Windows batch
files; it fixes a regression introduced with commit
3678ef2fa9893468604411ff697361bbd48d1e73.

Change-Id: I5df74d6e2efcabdf061cabe92d5da92d7a624740
Backports: 905070527fe2a6157672fc1a75977d8d62ac9a87
Closes-Bug: #1606766
Depends-On: I221cabdf5e9948dda81cefdff7c8f3b3ab96817c
(cherry picked from commit 730b7efed3ce542991a34f9cf2f083ae4f888e15)

commit_message:
Fix python35 job failures

- inspect.getargspec()` was deprecated in Python 3.0 and will be removed
  in 3.6 (ETA late 2016). From Python 3.5 it started throwing a deprecation
  warning which leds some tests failures.

Modify keystone,database,memcache,openvswitch, assignment to support kolla-k8s deployment.
Such as:
keystone_admin_url: "{{ admin_protocol }}://{{ kolla_internal_fqdn if orchestration_engine == 'ANSIBLE' else 'keystone-admin' }}:{{ keystone_admin_port }}/v3"

glance_database_address: "{% if orchestration_engine == 'ANSIBLE' %}{{ kolla_internal_fqdn }}{% else %}mariadb{% endif %}:{{ database_port }}"

Closes-Bug: #1624830

Change-Id: Ib8a53f13509057432ecd2c9aac64a66cd292747e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix keystone,database,memcache for k8s.

Modify keystone,database,memcache,openvswitch, assignment to support kolla-k8s deployment.
Such as:
keystone_admin_url: "{{ admin_protocol }}://{{ kolla_internal_fqdn if orchestration_engine == 'ANSIBLE' else 'keystone-admin' }}:{{ keystone_admin_port }}/v3"

glance_database_address: "{% if orchestration_engine == 'ANSIBLE' %}{{ kolla_internal_fqdn }}{% else %}mariadb{% endif %}:{{ database_port }}"

Closes-Bug: #1624830

Change-Id: Ib8a53f13509057432ecd2c9aac64a66cd292747e

commit_message:
To fix miscellaneous bugs in OVOs

1) In cinder/objects/qos_specs.py
the OPTIONAL_FIELDS is part of the class definition,
_from_db_object should no longer be a staticmethod,
 but should be a classmethod
2) Same issue fixed in cinder/objects/snapshot.py
3) cinder/api/views/qos_specs.py
The comma missing in dictionary definition
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/251989/27/cinder/api/views/qos_specs.py@44

Change-Id: I94977ffdd1dce5a44f19c1d35422cb37b54f8d25

subject: Cleanup container script improvement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-13 09:33:36.000000000', 'files': ['tools/cleanup-containers', 'ansible/roles/destroy/tasks/cleanup_containers.yml'], 'message': 'Cleanup container script improvement

Currently, when there are some qemu processes which may be some useful
virtual machines running by the operator running on non compute node, the
cleanup script will fail the cleanup operation for that node. We need to
ignore the qemu process check for non compute nodes.

Change-Id: If49a1a30764063935b2a65312de8f3b2357c7fbc
Closes-bug: 1633005
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup container script improvement

Currently, when there are some qemu processes which may be some useful
virtual machines running by the operator running on non compute node, the
cleanup script will fail the cleanup operation for that node. We need to
ignore the qemu process check for non compute nodes.

Change-Id: If49a1a30764063935b2a65312de8f3b2357c7fbc
Closes-bug: 1633005

subject: Make NullLogger more logger like
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-03 00:29:55.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py'], 'message': "Make NullLogger more logger like

eventlet.wsgi.server is adaptive to dealing with the named log
argument being either a file like or a log like [1], but message
handling is a more direct pass through if it's a log like.

Since all we want to do is make eventlet's logging it a noop - it's
easy to provide either interface!

1. https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/blob/4d2cdc/eventlet/wsgi.py#L246

Change-Id: I2d792176c96931eafb3f140e6653ba8b31eda429
"}]
commit_message:
Make NullLogger more logger like

eventlet.wsgi.server is adaptive to dealing with the named log
argument being either a file like or a log like [1], but message
handling is a more direct pass through if it's a log like.

Since all we want to do is make eventlet's logging it a noop - it's
easy to provide either interface!

1. https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/blob/4d2cdc/eventlet/wsgi.py#L246

Change-Id: I2d792176c96931eafb3f140e6653ba8b31eda429

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-02 18:13:22.000000000', 'files': ['test/probe/test_reconstructor_rebuild.py', 'test/probe/test_reconstructor_revert.py', 'test/probe/test_container_merge_policy_index.py', 'test/probe/test_replication_servers_working.py', 'test/probe/test_object_metadata_replication.py', 'test/probe/test_object_async_update.py', 'test/probe/test_reconstructor_durable.py', 'test/probe/test_object_expirer.py'], 'message': 'Use more specific asserts in test/probe tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.

e.g.: from assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*) or
assertTrue(isinstance(inst, type)) to assertIsInstace(inst, type) or
assertTrue(not sth) to assertFalse(sth).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail.

Change-Id: I3768faa568e3964e726ecc48ac8cb133cb088284
'}]
commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in test/probe tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.

e.g.: from assertTrue(sth == None) to assertIsNone(*) or
assertTrue(isinstance(inst, type)) to assertIsInstace(inst, type) or
assertTrue(not sth) to assertFalse(sth).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail.

Change-Id: I3768faa568e3964e726ecc48ac8cb133cb088284

commit_message:
host_info: fix has_plugin/get_plugin methods on HostInfo

"name" to "plugin_name" during review, but we missed
updates to HostInfo to take account of this.

subject: Remove custom OVS compilation trigger for Openstack CI
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-02 13:10:11.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/devstack-gate-bagpipe-rc'], 'message': 'Remove custom OVS compilation trigger for Openstack CI

Compiling a fresh upstream OVS is not required anymore now
that our tempest job is configured to use xenial.

(Note that the devstack-gate-bagpipe-rc script is only used by the
Openstack CI gate scripts so removing the OVS compilation trigger
does not impact non-gate use of the devstack plugin)

Change-Id: I50f2b6275400877e6e727a435406e362390dad46
'}]
commit_message:
Remove custom OVS compilation trigger for Openstack CI

Compiling a fresh upstream OVS is not required anymore now
that our tempest job is configured to use xenial.

(Note that the devstack-gate-bagpipe-rc script is only used by the
Openstack CI gate scripts so removing the OVS compilation trigger
does not impact non-gate use of the devstack plugin)

Change-Id: I50f2b6275400877e6e727a435406e362390dad46

subject: Revert "Start network connections after neutron forks workers"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-03 01:16:26.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/tests/unit/test_mech_driver.py', 'dragonflow/neutron/ml2/mech_driver.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Start network connections after neutron forks workers"

This reverts commit c807cd6c8a8f766cd1296b38eab21f296dfbd412.

My env is using redis.

With the commit, neutron-server can write data to nb db, but the df
controller can't get the notification. We may need to find another way
out. But revert the commit seems to be a quick fix.

Change-Id: I21c4aa2f155d7ef99e5c4efad59146514bd9f944
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Start network connections after neutron forks workers"

This reverts commit c807cd6c8a8f766cd1296b38eab21f296dfbd412.

My env is using redis.

With the commit, neutron-server can write data to nb db, but the df
controller can't get the notification. We may need to find another way
out. But revert the commit seems to be a quick fix.

Change-Id: I21c4aa2f155d7ef99e5c4efad59146514bd9f944

commit_message:
Set upper constraint to kombu

The lastest 4.0.0 kombu release causes gate failures in unit
tests due to some incompatible changes. Now we should set
kombu<4.0.0 to resolve the issue.

Change-Id: If02240b9c0c1e9cf9dee7368f23beb9840e3686d
Closes-Bug: #1638323

commit_message:
Trivial: Remove redundant variable

As I5b077f403e22ce1ff6833bc397afd21bf4d3e498, we can
simply do self.***['id'] instead of create a new variable. But
some other files are also the case. This patch changes these files
to make the code consistent.

Change-Id: Id317f81362a2c066994cc3385c2401494382de6e

commit_message:
Add external hiera override hierarchy levels

Additional hierarchy levels can be added to
"/etc/hiera/external" with a r10k friendly structure.

These levels can be used to apply overrides from the
external repository either per-environment or for
the default production environemnt.

Overrides can be applies either for every node,
or for the roles group from the "roles" facts, or
globally and per-cluster.

Change-Id: Ia9e0bf6213ce616e96f7c3598a362e1978f48e2a
Related-Bug: 1618139
Rally-Id: US763570

subject: Disable 'accept_ra' in DHCP agent namespace
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21784, 'name': 'Radek Zetik', 'email': 'radekx.zetik@intel.com', 'username': 'rzetikx'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-09-27 11:15:42.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_dhcp_agent.py', 'neutron/common/ipv6_utils.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': "Disable 'accept_ra' in DHCP agent namespace

The DHCP agent explicitly assigns address to the agent
based on the data model. Change
I85ef1f4d60efd0309d6a0706e29fdbcc16f0b59d made it so it
does this for IPv6 stateless networks as well to function
correctly with metadata. However, this opened a race condition
where the DHCP namespace may get an RA address before a permanent
address is assigned to it. If this happened, DHCP would be broken
for that network since the agent couldn't successfully assign the
address it wanted to the interface due to a conflict with the RA
address.

This patch disables RA in the DHCP namespace. There is no need for
the agent to get an RA address when we now statically give it
addresses. This also effectively reverts the fix in
I72b85eb93d1849299d523eedf563ab201b4a0352 since we now correctly
handle auto addressed subnets.

Closes-Bug: #1627902
Change-Id: I8684370ff1ad9387d0e2f450ce483b22b613a3c7
"}]
commit_message:
Disable 'accept_ra' in DHCP agent namespace

The DHCP agent explicitly assigns address to the agent
based on the data model. Change
I85ef1f4d60efd0309d6a0706e29fdbcc16f0b59d made it so it
does this for IPv6 stateless networks as well to function
correctly with metadata. However, this opened a race condition
where the DHCP namespace may get an RA address before a permanent
address is assigned to it. If this happened, DHCP would be broken
for that network since the agent couldn't successfully assign the
address it wanted to the interface due to a conflict with the RA
address.

This patch disables RA in the DHCP namespace. There is no need for
the agent to get an RA address when we now statically give it
addresses. This also effectively reverts the fix in
I72b85eb93d1849299d523eedf563ab201b4a0352 since we now correctly
handle auto addressed subnets.

Closes-Bug: #1627902
Change-Id: I8684370ff1ad9387d0e2f450ce483b22b613a3c7

subject: Swift proxy performance fixes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-01 11:31:56.000000000', 'files': ['templates/proxy-server.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Swift proxy performance fixes

Performance testing of an OSA deployed Swift cluster hit several issues.
Comparison of the proxy conf with the Swift Auth doc [1] found
two settings that affect performance that that were not set in the template.

include_service_catalog - This defaults to True which makes the proxy server
fetch the service catalog on every request in the authtoken middleware. This
hammers Keystone.

cache - When using memcache this should be set so the authtoken middleware
uses the correct cache and not go back to Keystone on every request.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/overview_auth.html

Change-Id: Iddaf097e3ff5c1b7118b11cfc598a40a91d6f96f
(cherry picked from commit b0f330e7b2a805c87a988d1cd312ec766e5e9f39)
(cherry picked from commit 621c821867ac1cd42dd40871d03c853536551728)
'}]
commit_message:
Swift proxy performance fixes

Performance testing of an OSA deployed Swift cluster hit several issues.
Comparison of the proxy conf with the Swift Auth doc [1] found
two settings that affect performance that that were not set in the template.

include_service_catalog - This defaults to True which makes the proxy server
fetch the service catalog on every request in the authtoken middleware. This
hammers Keystone.

cache - When using memcache this should be set so the authtoken middleware
uses the correct cache and not go back to Keystone on every request.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/overview_auth.html

Change-Id: Iddaf097e3ff5c1b7118b11cfc598a40a91d6f96f
(cherry picked from commit b0f330e7b2a805c87a988d1cd312ec766e5e9f39)
(cherry picked from commit 621c821867ac1cd42dd40871d03c853536551728)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-21 06:44:03.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/openstack/common/__init__.py'], 'message': "Files with no code must be left completely empty

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:
[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: I2df3d796aabbd2d283520b207bee3a80e663ecb4
"}]
commit_message:
Files with no code must be left completely empty

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:
[H104] Files with no code shouldn't contain any license header nor
comments, and must be left completely empty.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: I2df3d796aabbd2d283520b207bee3a80e663ecb4

commit_message:
Remove hard-coded host group

A previous commit added a hard-coded host group to
rabbitmq-install.yml, instead of using the variable rabbitmq_host_group.
This commit updates rabbitmq-install.yml to use rabbitmq_host_group
instead.

Change-Id: I4c4f8d0b903cc56ed025b7223b52d3205d9c9d37

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-30 18:33:44.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3'], 'message': 'Use FIXED_RANGE(_V6) as default subnet pool range

It turns out that many people have already chosen fixed ranges that work
for their environments. They have done so to avoid conflicts with
existing networking ranges and routing. The change to use 10.0.0.0/8 and
apply routes for this network to neutron interfaces prevents anyone from
using networks within that range for anything else.

For example imagine you have a cloud provider that provides private IPv4
addresses allocated out of ranges in 10.0.0.0/8 and they do all public
networking over ipv6. This change to devstack prevents you from using
those private networks properly after starting neutron with devstack.
However, in situations like this FIXED_RANGE should already represent a
safe range to use so just use it.

FIXED_RANGE_V6 is also increased to a /56 so that individual /64s can
be allocated for tenant networks.

Co-Authored-By: Sean M. Collins <sean@coreitpro.com>

Change-Id: I9f44803cf04b572074bdb4b97ee58827c5611514
'}]
commit_message:
Use FIXED_RANGE(_V6) as default subnet pool range

It turns out that many people have already chosen fixed ranges that work
for their environments. They have done so to avoid conflicts with
existing networking ranges and routing. The change to use 10.0.0.0/8 and
apply routes for this network to neutron interfaces prevents anyone from
using networks within that range for anything else.

For example imagine you have a cloud provider that provides private IPv4
addresses allocated out of ranges in 10.0.0.0/8 and they do all public
networking over ipv6. This change to devstack prevents you from using
those private networks properly after starting neutron with devstack.
However, in situations like this FIXED_RANGE should already represent a
safe range to use so just use it.

FIXED_RANGE_V6 is also increased to a /56 so that individual /64s can
be allocated for tenant networks.

Co-Authored-By: Sean M. Collins <sean@coreitpro.com>

Change-Id: I9f44803cf04b572074bdb4b97ee58827c5611514

commit_message:
WIP: Add expand/contract commands to glance-manage CLI.

The parent of this patch introduced the change to Alembic-based
migrations. This commit builds on top of that by adding expand
and contract commands to the glance-manage tool. Appropriate
documentation is updated and failing tests are adjusted to accomodate
the new database versioning schema.

Change-Id: Ib232a4217bf2716574edac2b4f912d4e127118d5

subject: Fix error status code on update-volume API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 19:16:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_volumes.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/contrib/volumes.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/volumes.py'], 'message': 'Fix error status code on update-volume API

As the following part of API-WG guidline[1],

  If a request contains a reference to a nonexistent resource in the
  body (not URI), the code should be 400 Bad Request. Do not use 404
  NotFound because :rfc:`7231#section-6.5.4` (section 6.5.4) mentions
  the origin server did not find a current representation for the
  target resource for 404 and representation for the target resource
  means a URI

Nova should return a BadRequest response(400) in this case, because
new_volume_id is specified in a request body. old_volume_id is not
necessary to be changed because the value is specified with URI.
So it is valid to return NotFound response if that is not existent.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/api-wg/blob/master/guidelines/http.rst#failure-code-clarifications

Close-Bug: #1629110
Change-Id: Ib781b116f5af713d64b5880858cc4f81c3da3977
(cherry picked from commit edd86d9dac1ea75bc580a7964e7d699ee9644b19)
(cherry picked from commit 4e6958551c324635a8720fc9125e9596860637f7)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix error status code on update-volume API

As the following part of API-WG guidline[1],

  If a request contains a reference to a nonexistent resource in the
  body (not URI), the code should be 400 Bad Request. Do not use 404
  NotFound because :rfc:`7231#section-6.5.4` (section 6.5.4) mentions
  the origin server did not find a current representation for the
  target resource for 404 and representation for the target resource
  means a URI

Nova should return a BadRequest response(400) in this case, because
new_volume_id is specified in a request body. old_volume_id is not
necessary to be changed because the value is specified with URI.
So it is valid to return NotFound response if that is not existent.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/api-wg/blob/master/guidelines/http.rst#failure-code-clarifications

Close-Bug: #1629110
Change-Id: Ib781b116f5af713d64b5880858cc4f81c3da3977
(cherry picked from commit edd86d9dac1ea75bc580a7964e7d699ee9644b19)
(cherry picked from commit 4e6958551c324635a8720fc9125e9596860637f7)

commit_message:
Create heat user in keystone profile

Rather than use the heat::keystone::domain class which also includes the
configuration options, we should just create the user for heat in
keystone independently of the configuration.

Change-Id: I7d42d04ef0c53dc1e62d684d8edacfed9fd28fbe
Related-Bug: #1638350
Closes-Bug: #1638626

commit_message:
Update upgrade instructions for M->N upgrades

Update the documentations with the additional steps needed
for an M->N upgrades.

 * Document ceilometer wsgi pre upgrade step
 * Document aodh data migration post converge step

We should address the following in a later commit:
- Some more details upstream about ceph jewel repos
- IgnoreCephWarnings notice when using only one ceph node

Closes-Bug: #1628551
Co-Authored-By: Marios Andreou <marios@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Replace 'MagicMock' with 'Mock'

MagicMock magically allow things to pass. Any usage should
be replaced with the Mock class and explicit attributes
should be set on it. [1]
[1] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17181687/mock-vs-magicmock

Change-Id: I0e78443825c9204d180ac369d52780a2a5352a89

subject: Move diskimage-image-create to an entry point
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-11-02 05:13:44.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/disk_image_create.py', 'tests/run_functests.sh', 'bin/diskimage_builder', 'diskimage_builder/lib/ramdisk-image-create', 'diskimage_builder/paths.py', 'setup.cfg', 'diskimage_builder/lib/disk-image-create', 'MANIFEST.in'], 'message': "Move diskimage-image-create to an entry point

It has always been a weird thing that dib is a python package, but
is totally driven by the disk-image-create script.  It creates this
strange division that is hard to explain.

This moves disk-image-create to a regular python entry-point

Currently, this simply exec()s the original disk-image-create script.

However, we now have a (private) interface between disk-image-create
written in python and the driver shell script.  Here's some things we
could do, for example:

* Argument parsing is generally nicer in Python, and then end result
  is mostly just setting environment variables to flag different things
  in the shell script.  I could see us moving the argument-parsing into
  diskimage_builder.disk_image_create:main() and just setting things in
  os.environ before the exec()).

* I7092e1845942f249175933d67ab121188f3511fd sets IMAGE_ELEMENT_YAML in
  disk-image-create by calling-back to element-info.  We can just call
  element_dependencies.find_all_elements() in here an export is to
  os.environ before disk-image-create starts.

* remove need for ramdisk-image-create symlink by just exporting
  IS_RAMDISK based on sys.argv[1] value

* you could even unit test some of this :)

Change-Id: I69ca3d26fede0506a6353c077c69f735c8d84d28
"}]
commit_message:
Move diskimage-image-create to an entry point

It has always been a weird thing that dib is a python package, but
is totally driven by the disk-image-create script.  It creates this
strange division that is hard to explain.

This moves disk-image-create to a regular python entry-point

Currently, this simply exec()s the original disk-image-create script.

However, we now have a (private) interface between disk-image-create
written in python and the driver shell script.  Here's some things we
could do, for example:

* Argument parsing is generally nicer in Python, and then end result
  is mostly just setting environment variables to flag different things
  in the shell script.  I could see us moving the argument-parsing into
  diskimage_builder.disk_image_create:main() and just setting things in
  os.environ before the exec()).

* I7092e1845942f249175933d67ab121188f3511fd sets IMAGE_ELEMENT_YAML in
  disk-image-create by calling-back to element-info.  We can just call
  element_dependencies.find_all_elements() in here an export is to
  os.environ before disk-image-create starts.

* remove need for ramdisk-image-create symlink by just exporting
  IS_RAMDISK based on sys.argv[1] value

* you could even unit test some of this :)

Change-Id: I69ca3d26fede0506a6353c077c69f735c8d84d28

commit_message:
Cleanup before removal of conductor local apis

Some old cruft from the when conductor proxying was being used to
make db calls are left in various places in unit tests. None of this
is of use anymore and needs to be removed before the conductor local
apis and related 'use_local' flag can be removed.

Change-Id: Id5fe30f4124396ac59ef3d008972db4dd930855d

oslo.messaging is not compatible with it, for two reasons: because we
cap amqp<2.0.0 there; and because the code of the library needs some
adjustments.

Until we clear that up, we will block the new  kombu release. We don't

commit_message:
Block kombu 4.0.0

oslo.messaging is not compatible with it, for two reasons: because we
cap amqp<2.0.0 there; and because the code of the library needs some
adjustments.

Until we clear that up, we will block the new  kombu release. We don't
cap because it's against the direction we want to take long term
(adopting to new upstream releases).

Change-Id: I34e0ca49966d679ff60d4bcfbf7157c6289a9aef
Related-Bug: #1638263

commit_message:
tempest HAHT wait for sync

Add a wait timer in tests that rely on replicated nodes to sync.
With this change, the gate-congress-pe-replicated-nv test is
expected to pass and this provides useful feedback.
Note: the existing retry logic do not work for some reason.
But we don't fix the retry logic because retry is undesirable for
this kind of testing (explained in comment).

Change-Id: Ic9adc1ddcb1e86e5ab75d1154b8bfa45b51f3fa1

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-31 13:21:07.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix AdminPassword for overcloud during upgrades

In newton the password generation moved to a workflow.  In the case
when an overcloud is upgraded from mitaka to newton, the previous
OS_PASSWORD/AdminPassword should be respected if found in the
environment.

This is a one cycle fix that should be immediately considered
as deprecated and will be removed in ocata as upgrades from
newton to ocata should both use the password generation workflow.

Closes-Bug: 1638003
Change-Id: I05dbbe61f3ff8da182739aa41512b76fc86cb7a6
backport: newton
'}]
commit_message:
Fix AdminPassword for overcloud during upgrades

In newton the password generation moved to a workflow.  In the case
when an overcloud is upgraded from mitaka to newton, the previous
OS_PASSWORD/AdminPassword should be respected if found in the
environment.

This is a one cycle fix that should be immediately considered
as deprecated and will be removed in ocata as upgrades from
newton to ocata should both use the password generation workflow.

Closes-Bug: 1638003
Change-Id: I05dbbe61f3ff8da182739aa41512b76fc86cb7a6
backport: newton

subject: Fix test_revoke to run all tests after pki removal
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-02 18:33:42.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_revoke.py'], 'message': 'Fix test_revoke to run all tests after pki removal

The recent change [1] caused the removal of a certain class that
looked specific to PKI and PKIz testing and implementation, however,
actually was being used to test all supported token providers. This
caused a chunk of tests to simply not run at all and therefore be
overlooked. This change adds support for both UUID and Fernet so that
all tests are being run once again and for all available token
providers.

[1]: Icf1ebced44a675c88fb66a6c0431208ff5181574
Change-Id: I5365e2ed74ea55377729d0910cc2892d2bb8889c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix test_revoke to run all tests after pki removal

The recent change [1] caused the removal of a certain class that
looked specific to PKI and PKIz testing and implementation, however,
actually was being used to test all supported token providers. This
caused a chunk of tests to simply not run at all and therefore be
overlooked. This change adds support for both UUID and Fernet so that
all tests are being run once again and for all available token
providers.

[1]: Icf1ebced44a675c88fb66a6c0431208ff5181574
Change-Id: I5365e2ed74ea55377729d0910cc2892d2bb8889c

commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example).
To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example).
To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

commit_message:
Make reproduce.sh header more accurate

We run on more than ubuntu trusty now, try to reflect that information
and tell people where to determine exactly what distro to run on to
properly reproduce a job. Also update the package list to include
libssl-dev as it is now needed for cryptography things.

Change-Id: I635b133b1775a6a931f520404a5fa8a23514e60f

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-11-02 17:03:43.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/v3/domain_configs.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/unit/v3/test_domain_configs.py', 'keystoneclient/v3/client.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bp-domain-config-9566e672a98f4e7f.yaml', 'keystoneclient/tests/functional/v3/client_fixtures.py', 'doc/source/using-api-v3.rst', 'keystoneclient/tests/functional/v3/test_domain_configs.py'], 'message': 'Support domain-specific configuration management

Provide support for the domain-specific configuration storage available
via the REST API.

Domain configs are JSON blobs and we have fine grained control on them
via the Identity API. This fine grained control is not defined yet in the
client, though - for now, we can manage everything like Python dictionaries
and use operations like "update" whenever we want to delete a specific group
or option. This approach is similar to what is done in the federation mapping

Functional tests are also included, this is useful to check if the new
feature works in an integration environment.

Co-Auhtored-By: Henry Nash <henryn@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte <rduartes@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ie6795b8633fed38c58b79250c11c9a045b7f95a4
'}]
commit_message:
Support domain-specific configuration management

Provide support for the domain-specific configuration storage available
via the REST API.

Domain configs are JSON blobs and we have fine grained control on them
via the Identity API. This fine grained control is not defined yet in the
client, though - for now, we can manage everything like Python dictionaries
and use operations like "update" whenever we want to delete a specific group
or option. This approach is similar to what is done in the federation mapping
API to handle mapping rules.

Functional tests are also included, this is useful to check if the new
feature works in an integration environment.

Co-Auhtored-By: Henry Nash <henryn@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte <rduartes@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: 1433306

Partially Implements: blueprint domain-config-ext

Change-Id: Ie6795b8633fed38c58b79250c11c9a045b7f95a4

commit_message:
conf: remove use_local from conductor

use_local was deprecated since 13.0 release - this patch
removes it completely.

This legacy mode was introduced to bridge a gap during
the transition to the conductor service.
It no longer represents a reasonable alternative for deployers.

Change-Id: Ibb9deeaab79044d8655229076df72cb809b93a55
Implements: bp centralize-config-options-ocata

subject: [Testing] Xenial systemd cgroup messaround
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-02 17:04:44.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/gate-check-commit.sh', 'scripts/scripts-library.sh'], 'message': "[Testing] Xenial systemd cgroup messaround

One of the theories about the Xenial CI slowdowns is around cgroups.
This patch tests a few things:

* Enables CPU accounting
* Sets the CPU shares for the user.slice (where Ansible runs) to the max

ᴛʜɪꜱ ᴍᴀʏ ɴᴏᴛ ᴡᴏʀᴋ, ʙᴜᴛ ʟᴇᴛ'ꜱ ɢɪᴠᴇ ɪᴛ ᴀ ꜱʜᴏᴛ.

Change-Id: Ibbd0ed2e4080947d87306ad22b27a22664e02a7e
"}]
commit_message:
[Testing] Xenial systemd cgroup messaround

One of the theories about the Xenial CI slowdowns is around cgroups.
This patch tests a few things:

* Enables CPU accounting
* Sets the CPU shares for the user.slice (where Ansible runs) to the max

ᴛʜɪꜱ ᴍᴀʏ ɴᴏᴛ ᴡᴏʀᴋ, ʙᴜᴛ ʟᴇᴛ'ꜱ ɢɪᴠᴇ ɪᴛ ᴀ ꜱʜᴏᴛ.

Change-Id: Ibbd0ed2e4080947d87306ad22b27a22664e02a7e

subject: dd missing memory.resident to NOVA_METERS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-01 17:33:59.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/alarm_base.py'], 'message': 'dd missing memory.resident to NOVA_METERS

memory.resident is missing from NOVA_METERS list. This causes the
wrong metadata format for alarms on this meter if a heat stack
is used to create it. Basically, you will see the query in the
alarm generated by the heatstack will incorrect be set to
metadata.metering.stack instead of metadata.user_metadata.stack.

Change-Id: Ic95f8c98c020627c6c5322c905cbf1c160d8445b

(cherry picked from commit a408ccd1791ba758ddaa81d1e1f3be9250623bd0)

commit_message:
dd missing memory.resident to NOVA_METERS

memory.resident is missing from NOVA_METERS list. This causes the
wrong metadata format for alarms on this meter if a heat stack
is used to create it. Basically, you will see the query in the
alarm generated by the heatstack will incorrect be set to
metadata.metering.stack instead of metadata.user_metadata.stack.

Change-Id: Ic95f8c98c020627c6c5322c905cbf1c160d8445b
Closes-Bug: #1623680
(cherry picked from commit a408ccd1791ba758ddaa81d1e1f3be9250623bd0)

subject: Add supported Operating System check
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 09:07:07.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/check-requirements.yml', 'playbooks/openstack-hosts-setup.yml'], 'message': 'Add supported Operating System check

Regardless of documentation covering the supported Operating
Systems for a given release, there are still issues that arise
which turn out to relate to someone using an unsupported
OS.

This patch adds an early pre-requisite check for both an AIO
and a full deployment to hard stop the deployment if an
unsupported OS is detected on any host.

Related-Bug: 1638113
Change-Id: I6bc1a15e1283d496adb82a67989486f814e341c7
'}]
commit_message:
Add supported Operating System check

Regardless of documentation covering the supported Operating
Systems for a given release, there are still issues that arise
which turn out to relate to someone using an unsupported
OS.

This patch adds an early pre-requisite check for both an AIO
and a full deployment to hard stop the deployment if an
unsupported OS is detected on any host.

Related-Bug: 1638113
Change-Id: I6bc1a15e1283d496adb82a67989486f814e341c7

commit_message:
Revert "drop non-I/O threading in upgrade"

This reverts commit 84443ca4d47cbee9efa0e1ad1df63ff2ae7f8b1f.

Upgrade with some storage drivers such as Swift consumes a lot of I/O with high
latency, so running in parallel improve speed.

Change-Id: I65106a5fbb8cd19235274ea55fb19fe2ecff9093
(cherry picked from commit c95b98f76574af1138129f6696fe0d30f1b1155f)

commit_message:
libvirt: Pass Host instead of Driver to volume drivers

We were initialising libvirt volume drivers by passing the
LibvirtDriver object. However, this is only ever used to fetch the
Host. We update the interface to pass the Host instead. This is
cleaner, but also better represents the intent of the interface. They
should not be able to access arbitrary attributes of the LibvirtDriver
object.

Change-Id: I87ceeee1ec46dc22754321574b16e6c47b27a848

subject: Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-02 13:27:18.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/remove-requirements-git-451af20d60205c17.yaml', 'tasks/install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Change-Id: I7693b98ddefbc3d8365581e35cddfc5d3e39f803
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

Change-Id: I7693b98ddefbc3d8365581e35cddfc5d3e39f803

commit_message:
memcache: use composable service

Use composable service from THT to deploy Memcached, so we have the same
configuration on undercloud and overcloud.

It will help us to fix #1638646 and also move forward our undercloud to
be able to run composable services later with heat-undercloud blueprint.

Depends-On: Iec2032b9d367c33b3f4feaef6122e52bdc1d2c7f
Change-Id: Idbededbefad6a7443ef3f3aecd76f9442426d403
Related-Bug: #1638646

on an empty inventory group. This greatly simplifies the logic around
running things for single node and multinode testing. Be prepared for

Change-Id: I3b2bc9adc0f581b60adb0a58787461418cb25a0c

commit_message:
Use new ansible 2.2 for bugfixes

The ansible 2.2 release returns the old ansible 2.0 behavior of nooping
on an empty inventory group. This greatly simplifies the logic around
running things for single node and multinode testing. Be prepared for
this release when it arrives.

Change-Id: I3b2bc9adc0f581b60adb0a58787461418cb25a0c

subject: Configure memcache file limits
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-02 18:21:23.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/memcached.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/kernel.pp'], 'message': 'Configure memcache file limits

The memcache package was recently updated and it requires that the end
user configure the limits file for the memcache user if you configure
the max connections to be greater than 1024.

Note: we add the code in kernel profile so it pass CI jobs (so
undercloud will also configure limits). This is a workaround and will be
cleanup as soon as possible.

Change-Id: Iec2032b9d367c33b3f4feaef6122e52bdc1d2c7f
Closes-Bug: #1638646
'}]
commit_message:
Configure memcache file limits

The memcache package was recently updated and it requires that the end
user configure the limits file for the memcache user if you configure
the max connections to be greater than 1024.

Note: we add the code in kernel profile so it pass CI jobs (so
undercloud will also configure limits). This is a workaround and will be
cleanup as soon as possible.

Change-Id: Iec2032b9d367c33b3f4feaef6122e52bdc1d2c7f
Closes-Bug: #1638646

subject: Increase files limit for memcache
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-02 17:47:58.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/memcached.pp', 'Puppetfile', 'external_modules.txt'], 'message': 'Increase files limit for memcache

The new version of the memcache package is failing due to a rlimit issue
because of the default max_connections in the memcache module. This
change includes a limits configuration and explicitly defines the max
number of connections.

Change-Id: I7d75bbdfc9ebc517be2220c52bcc3cdd3b031626
'}]
commit_message:
Increase files limit for memcache

The new version of the memcache package is failing due to a rlimit issue
because of the default max_connections in the memcache module. This
change includes a limits configuration and explicitly defines the max
number of connections.

Change-Id: I7d75bbdfc9ebc517be2220c52bcc3cdd3b031626

revisions:

Before this patch all empty but existing plugin metadata properties was
removed from output as well as `tasks` field that was not respecting
not null constraint at DB level.

commit_message:
Empty fields processed correctly in plugin adapters

Before this patch all empty but existing plugin metadata properties was
removed from output as well as `tasks` field that was not respecting
not null constraint at DB level.

As a minor patch payload missing InvalidFileFormat error was added.

Change-Id: I6a21e347fefb7a9a30be562b7fb3e4a8c5c61a36
Partial-Bug: 1616722
Closes-Bug: 1626855
